title: Do you watch Korean dramas? What Korean dramas do you like the most? - Quora

response.answer_text: A Korean Drama Addict here. I’ve been addicted to Kdrama since 2014. I could go to lectures because I wanted to use the school WiFi to download a Kdrama, but not to listen to what the lecturer has. I can say it affected my academic life a bit, but I’ve never regretted. I want to make something clear, You can’t out-watch me when it comes to kdrama. I’ve watched over 300. Amazingly, I don’t delete them. So as we speak, about 80% of them are still on my PC. I’ll give you my favorite Kdrama in the following Categories: Historical Korean DramasKorean Dramas about Foreign Invasion of KoreaModern, Action, Revenge Korean DramaCrime and Investigative KdramaBadass Korean Dramas (both action and non-action badass)Con Artists, Players, Scams, and Robinhood-like Korean DramasUpcoming Korean Dramas I’m waiting forThese are just my favorite ones in each category. Historical Kdramas. I’ve watched many historical Kdramas and there are 3 that catch my heart, at least for now: Jumong. (I’ve watch this drama over and over, about 7 times now) This drama is about the founding of the Gogryeo Kingdom. It was my first kdrama, and since then, I’ve never watched a historical drama that has the suspense, betrayal, life, lessons, and beauty of this drama. The continuation of this movie, which is Kingdom of the Winds, is equally good. 2. Emperor of the Sea (Sea god)  After my obsession with Jumong, and especially the main Character, Song Il Gook, I decided to search for more of his dramas, and then I chanced on this. It’s another great historical drama that I’ll always watch again. 3. Six Flying Dragons  Focusing on Lee Bang Won, the young prince, Six Flying Dragons tells the story of the foundation of the Joseon Dynasty in Korea and ambitions, success and conflicts of several real and fictional people. This is a piece that I love as well. Others historical dramas I can’t forget: Lee SanEmpress KiGu Family BookDong YiShine or Go CrazyTree With Deep RootYou might be a great Kdrama addict as well, but if you’ve not watched Jumong, I entreat you to go back to the drawing table. Think you’ve watched more historical drama more than me? No, from the Scholar who walks the night to Jewel in the palace, historical dramas don’t skip me. I’ve not watched a few of them though. Foreign Invasion of Korean Dramas Koreans have nice dramas covering the time the country was invaded by Japan, especially. I’m going to summarize these dramas before I list them. These dramas are about the foreign invasion of Korean and how a group of Koreans came together to fight for the freedom of their people. Those that caught my eye in this category: Bridal Mask 2. Mr. Sunshine  3. Inspiring Generation  4. Different Dreams (Still airing)  Others Foreign Invasion dramas I can’t ignore: Chicago TypewriterFreedom Fighter Lee Hoe YoungCapital Scandal (2007)Modern, Action, and Revenge This category is about modern movies, revenge, and some action. It’s a genre that I seem to have created myself, and I love watching dramas in this category. It’s my second best genre after historical dramas. With this category, I’ll love to hear more suggestion from other people about the best movies, because it’s broad and there are many that I haven’t watched. Also, I usually like those with a dose of action and plot. Some memorable ones in this category are: A Man Called God This drama is like City Hunter, but has action-packed and tech-prowess scenese than city hunter. And as I said earlier, I’m obsessed with dramas where Song Il Gook is the main character. 2. City Hunter  3. Heartless City  4. Descendants of the sun  5. The K2  6. Iris 1& 2  7. Athena: Goddess of War  8. Healer  9. Kill It  10. Look Out  Others I can’t ignore in this category Money FlowerTwo WeeksTime Between Dog and WolfThe Fugitive: Plan BMoorim SchoolGhostSignalTunnelMy Beautiful BrideAre You HumanCrime & Investigative - My Favorites Gap DongCriminal MindsMissing Noir MSpecial Affairs Team TenVoice 1, 2, & 3Children of a lesser godI hear your voiceI Remember you (Hello Monster)Cheo YongInvestigation CoupleRoom No. 9Children of NobodyThe Last EmpressGhost/PhantomHidden IdentityWantedBadass Kdramas that I love I’ve not watched a lot of movies in this category, so anyone can suggest nice badass kdrama that’s not here. I think the characters in these dramas were badass in some way or the other. Bad GuysBad Guys: City Of EvilThree DaysStrong Girl Boon SoonWhisper (non-action badass)Lawless Lawyer (one of my best)Stranger (non-action badass)Neighborhood HeroCon Artists, Player, Scams, Robinhood-like Kdrama. This category is about kdramas on scams and players. (no historical is added here). Some of my favorites in this category are: The Player38 Task ForceSwitch: Change the WorldLegend of the Blue Sea (part con artist, part supernatural)Upcoming Korean Dramas I’m Waiting For Some of these korean dramas are still airing or about to finish, and with the trailers I’ve watched, I think they’ll be good: The Nokdu Flower -(Historical)Vagabond - thriller, action, crimeArthdal Chronicles (some characters from Descendants of the sun) - historicalSearch: WWW (I’m waiting for this because the main lead for Kill It is also here.Aide -(political)If you’re aware of any upcoming action or crime korean drama, i’ll love to know. Thanks So, the reason is, you will not see a lot of romance in this list because I’m not a die-hard fan of romance kdramas. However, I’ve watched some that I’m really proud of. Any other kdrama suggestion in the action, crime, love/romance (if the story is good), I would love to hear from all of you. Thanks.

i have watched a lot of Asian drama like may be 100+ or even more. but there are some dramas that i want they should have never ended or i took too much time to move on to another drama. i have listed some of my favorite dramas of all the time…i can watch them over and over again W- The two World  The story is about girl who gets dragged into the comic world which was created by her father. she fall in love with a comic character. Every episode is filled with so much suspense.there is not a single minute in each episode where you will feel bored. Memories of the Alhambra  It is the unique and suspenseful love story of Yoo Jin Woo and Jung Hee Joo. Strong spirited Yoo Jin Woo is the CEO of an investment company with a degree in engineering and a knack for developing video games. He has an adventurous and competitive spirit. Suffering after his best friend betrays him, he takes a business trip to Granada, Spain, where he ends up at a hostel. Jung Hee Joo owns this hostel. Hee Joo is a former classical guitarist who came to Spain to further her studies. After the death of her parents, she takes on various jobs to support herself, including running the old hostel . They are both drawn into a series of strange and unexpected events. Writer of W -The two worlds and Memory of Alhambra is Song Jae Jung. Thats why the two stories are little bit same. Scarlet Heart-Ryeo  The story set up in the early of Goryeo regime. Hae Soo, a 25-year-old girl from modern era got transported back to Goryeo dynasty and got trapped in the conflicts and struggles between princes of Wang’s House. There, she falls in love with Wang So, who makes other people tremble with fear. End of this drama makes your heart feel empty. Goblin This drama is full of thriller with a hand full of comedy + taste of romance and ofcourse all this with a good plot. Kim Shin is a goblin who is also a protector of souls. He lives together with an amnesiac grim reaper who is in charge of taking deceased souls. Shin doesn’t want to be immortal anymore and seeks a human bride in order to end his immortality. Meanwhile, Ji Eun Tak is a high school student who despite her painful reality, remains optimistic, ends up falling in love with the goblin. Sunny is an owner of a chicken shop, she is a bright and attractive girl who is loved by all men. However, while encountering hardship in her reckless life, she’ll meet the reaper and begin to change...  Strong-Woman-Do-Bong-Soon  Its a cute love story. Do Bong Soon is said to be so strong that touching something carelessly can result in a breakage. Meanwhile, In Dook Goo has been harboring an unrequited crush on her since elementary school. When she becomes the bodyguard of chaebol heir Ahn Min Hyuk, they quickly get involved in a twisted love triangle. My love from another star  Jun Ji Hyun acting is brilliant as always. If she is in the drama then it will be lot of fun while watching the drama. Do Min Joon is an alien who landed on Earth 400 years ago during the Joseon Dynasty period. He possesses a near perfect appearance and enhanced physical abilities involving his vision, hearing and speed. Later, he discovers that he has three months left on Earth. And that is when he meets Cheon Song Yi, the biggest Hallyu star in Korea. Suspicious partner  Noh Ji Wook is a prosecutor in the Central District Prosecutors’ Office who ends up switching professions to a private attorney. He harbors a trauma stemming from an event in his childhood involving his parents and his first love. Eun Bong Hee, a Taekwondo athlete in her youth, is a prosecutor trainee who has become a murder suspect. Due to a murderer's amnesia, Eun Bong Hee and Noh Ji Wook both find themselves being his target. My Secret Romance  Cha Jin Wook is a son from a wealthy family who runs a large company. He usually only pursues short-term love, but when he meets Lee Yoo Mi, who has never had a boyfriend before, he changes. In a dating world full of busy people who tend to flirt and chase “some” relationships rather than having meaningful connections that allow them to show their true feelings, this couple has a one-night stand. They meet again three years later, whereupon they kick off a shaky push-pull romance that’ll keep them on their toes as they fall in love. Uncontrollably Fond  When Shin Joon Young and No Eul were younger, they were separated and became heartbroken. As adults, they meet again. Shin Joon Young is now a top actor and singer. He is intelligent and attractive. No Eul is the PD of documentaries. She values money over justice and kisses up to those with more power than her. Finding True Love  Girl breakup with her boyfriend after 5 year of dating and reasons were quite similar to our real lives. After that she met with a new guy who is better in every way. And then her ex appers. Now she is confused between two and trying to convince her heart. In short its a romcom drama with love triangle. It is really worth to watch. Currently I am watching : The Last empress  Set in an alternate universe, in which Korea is a constitutional monarchy in 2018, Oh Sunny is a bright and vivacious musical actress who marries the emperor. She becomes involved in the palace power struggle and a mysterious murder that sets off events that threaten the monarchy itself, while searching for true love and happiness. But, she ends up falling in love with Na Wang Sik who works as a bodyguard for the imperial family. He started working in the palace to take revenge on the person responsible for his mother’s death Shall we fall in love  its a C-drama.A story filled with hilarious circumstances that leave you not knowing whether to laugh or cry. It follows a young man's journey from nothing into someone who proves himself at work and wins over love and friendship. Jiang Yi Nan is an unemployed youth with limited options due to his lack of credentials, Nevertheless, he is optimistic and cheerful as he waits among the many people in the jobless pool. During a random encounter, Yi Nan saves Chen Xin Yue who has fallen into the water. Encouraged by his attraction to her and Xu Hao Yu's provocations, Yinan applies to work at the same company as Chen Xin Yue. Yi Nan relies on his hard work and quick thinking to not only secure the job but to become the top applicant of ShenYuan Group's open recruitment. Unhappy with Yi Nan's happy-go-lucky attitude, Xu Hao Yu makes life difficult for Yi Nan at every turn. His girlfriend Liang Ding Fei, on the other hand, is full of curiosity towards Yi Nan. As it turns out, Yi Nan's acceptance was a mere mistake by President Jin who tries to cover it up by roping in colleagues to ensure that Yi Nan is pushed out of the company. Romance is a Bonus Book  A brilliant man becomes involved in the life of a once rising star. Cha Eun Ho is a successful and handsome writer who is also the youngest chief editor at a publishing company. He has a calm demeanor, alongside a warm heart and remains reasonable at work. He then meets a woman named Kang Dan Yi who was once a popular copywriter. She is now unemployed and struggling in life thought still attempts to find a job, but even with her outstanding educational past and once good career, she cannot. However, in a desperate attempt to find a job, she lies about her background and begins to work as a temporary worker in the same building under none other than Cha Eun Ho. As they meet each other time and time again, a love story begins to unfold.

I actually started watching K-drama’s in the ‘90’s when I lived in South Korea. I started watching them again about 8 years ago. The first one that I watched was called Foxy Lady and it set the pattern for how I watch many K-dramas - I don’t finish them. Foxy Lady was my introduction to what, I assume, is the acting out of the fantasies of Korean women. First, education and careers are super important in South Korea. So, the lead characters in kd’s are often under-educated and under-employed. Didn’t go to college? Have a low-paying job? Don’t worry, you can still marry a chaebol. (This didn’t happen in Foxy Lady) Second, women are under a lot of pressure to make the right marriage. So, in the dramas they often make what I consider to be the wrong choice when it comes to choosing the man for them. In Foxy Lady the lead chose a man many years her junior over a doctor who loved her. And yes, I get the whole romance of the thing…I guess I am just too pragmatic. However, I also hate when the lead chooses a man who is a total jerk over an awesome and nice man. This happened in Pretty Man and in Shining Inheritance, a kd that I highly recommend you *never* watch, and a lot of other dramas. Third, young men leave for two years to do mandatory military service. I assume this is really hard on relationships. So, to flip this harsh reality, the lead in kd’s sometimes leaves for two years. And I hate this. I find it completely unnecessary. If I could remember the names of some of the Kd’s this happened in, I’d be ranting a bit more. It happened in Coffee Prince, where at least it basically made sense with the storyline. This leads me to another thing that I don’t like about Kd’s. Terrible endings! I know that I am being unrealistic. I mean, it would really be boring if every rom-com ended with the couple getting married. But that is what I want. I want to see them happy. I want to know that everything worked out well. I don’t want to be left guessing like in Marry Him if You Dare. I just watched My Beautiful Gong Shim, and I might recommend it if it didn’t end with a two year separation (reduced to 1) and a ridiculous “I couldn’t find a moment to call you the entire time I was in the US, but I still love you and let’s get married.” ARGH! But really, most kd’s I don’t even finish. I’ve learned to push through the choosing the wrong guy thing - for the most part. (I will forever be crushed that the shy girl ended up with the FlowerBoy Next Door instead of the super-nice artist.) But the boredom often kills the show for me. So many shows get boring in the middle…I have no idea if the boredom carries on through the end because I just give up. I was so looking forward to watching Big and Gong Yoo did a great job acting in it…but the boredom killed me halfway through. (However, I must say that while Gong Yoo did a great job acting like a teenage boy…he didn’t act anything like the teenage boy he was supposed to be portraying.) Anyway, this was a long way to say that I am very picky and if I finished a drama it should be at least good enough to watch. Here are my recommendations: Coffee Prince - the second drama that I watched and the first that I finished. I absolutely love this drama and have re-watched it countless times. While it includes some of the things that I complained of above, it does not fit the mold of a typical k-drama. I cannot recommend it highly enough.Secret Garden - this one is also great. I recommend watching it without reading about it first, to preserve the surprise element.The History of the Salaryman - I never see this on other lists and that makes me sad. It isn’t a rom-com. It is a comedy about an underdog. It just love it and, like Coffee Prince and Secret Garden, have watched it many times.Those are my top three and I recommend that everyone watch them. The following are K-dramas that I finished and like well enough to recommend: 4. My Love From the Stars* 5. Oh My Ghostess 6. Master’s Sun 7. Cheese in the Trap* 8. Good Doctor 9. Pinocchio 10. Tomorrow’s Cantabile…maybe 11. Pasta 12. It’s Okay, That’s Love 13. Greatest Love* 14. Seoulmate* 15. A Gentleman’s Dignity 16. 49 Days 17. Queen In-Hyun’s Man/The Princess’s Man* I starred the ones that I particularly like.

I am on the track to become a biggest fan of Kdramas. Until now I have completed 7 kdramas and watching 8th one.. Below is the list of K-dramas sequentially I have watched - 1.Boys over flowers-This is the drama which one must see while entering into k-drama world.This drama includes all spices of drama(love story,love triangle, rich-poor difference, etc.)with korean touch.After watching this kdrama you will fall in love with Gu Jun pyo(Lee min hoo),All the awesome songs of bof and….  2.Heirs- It is also a high school drama like a Bof. Story is also based on ups and downs in rich families.  3.weightlifting fairy-It is the story based on weightlifters.Really they pick a unique topic and present it well.Also a cute love story makes it a perfect k-drama.  4.Doctors-Now from this drama I think I have started watching mature k-drama ,I mean beyond the high school drama,family dramas,simple love stories.This drama shows the whole life of doctors,their responsibilities with a very cute love story .Also the doctor in this drama are damn handsome specially Dr.Hong ,with full on guts.Also Actress park shin was great as a doctor ,I became her fan from this drama..  5.Descendants of the sun-This is the epic war drama. It contains disaster, disease, drug dealings and even human trafficking but also has essential aspects such as humour, romance and above all chemistry between all the actors not only leads but all of them are awesome actors.Also the song-song couple rocks here..  6.Pinocchio-I can just tell about this is awesome drama,best actors,nice story,best screenplay, best direction. The story is based on reporters.When I saw this drama ,I really thought that ‘why I am not a reporter..oh god I should have watched this drama before taking my career decision'.The study about reporters is so deep that not a single point in their profession has missed.Really one should watch this drama.  7.W-Two worlds- No words for this Drama. The story is beyond the imagination.Writer has designed each and every character so perfectly and deeply that we think those are real .It is the story with full of package of action,thriller, love story,fantacy. Story consist of two worlds, one is real and other is cartoon.The hero from cartoon world is Kang chul who is super cute met the girl Oh yeon joo from real world who is the daughter of cartoon maker. I think Instead of listening the story from me, you must must must watch this drama .This is one of the best k-drama ever.I'm watching the other dramas also but still can't get myself out from ‘W'.  P.S.According to me the rankings are in reverse order as mentioned above. Okk Don't wait too much and start to watch K-dramas.

A biiiigg YES! I love watching Korean dramas. I enjoy watching all types of Kdramas. And the best part is that most of the kdramas have a tint of various genres in it making them all the more lovable. So here are my top 5 kdramas. Strong girl do bong soon- Well this is my all time favorite drama. It's a story about a "SUPERPOWER GIRL ❤️" who has magic in her genes. It has the perfect blend of comedy, romance, drama, action, fiction as well as thrill. The star cast is amazing & with leads as Park Bo-Young, Park Hyung-sik & Ji soo. The witty character & flawless acting of Bong soon (Park bo-young) will keep you hooked while Park Hyung-sik is definitely a sight to sore eyes😍. It has got an amazing story line as well. So you will definitely not be disappointed.. 2.Descendants of the sun: This story revolves around the struggles faced by a doctor ( Song hye-kyo) & soldier( Song Joong-ki) who are not able to be together due to their busy jobs & different ideals. However destiny (here the script writer 😉) has its own ways & means to bring 2 lovers together. It is mostly a love story but does have a lot of action comedy & drama. The story, second leads, supporting cast, OST have also done an excellent job in keeping the audience engaged. Caution: You might fall in love with either Doctor Kang (Song hye-kyo) or Yoo Si Jin( Song Joong-ki) so please put a seat belt on your hearts😉  3.Weight lifting fairy Kim Bok-Joo: This overall looks like an average romantic comedy drama however deals with a number of sensitive topics in the most light hearted way that we never talk about. Like remember the first heartbreak your friends told you was not worth crying over but you still did, or about the craziest things you did just to have a glimpse of that one person ( who was never yours to begin with), how sometimes your loved ones genuine concern seems to bother you the most, the joy of just having friends & family, the fear of losing it all, being left out. It's all in here. It's a heart warming drama that will leave you smiling.  4.Doctors: This is that one rare drama that made me cry in almost every single episode. It is one top notch medical drama with great scenes of surgeries & operations. Had I seen this before my 10th I would have surely joined a medical college😛. The plot portrays the story of a rebellious teen Hye Jeong who mends her ways of living when shown love & affection by her grandma & teacher. This is one drama layered with multiple stories nicely woven into it. It is nicely packed with a bad ass heroine, warm corny hero 😍, vicious villain & adorable second leads. It is an emotional medical drama with elements of comedy & romance.  5.Suspicious Partner: As the name suggests the female lead is a suspect of a high profile murder case.( It's not a spoiler). It is a very underrated drama but has an amazing plot that involves murder, mystery, crime,suspense, romance, comedy,heartbreak..... You can find it aaaalllll in this. It is filled with a number of twists & turn that will keep you hooked throughout the drama.

I would be happy to! Allow me to offer up my Top 5 All-time favorite Korean Dramas. About two years ago I accidentally stumbled upon my first Korean series while struggling with a bout of depression (literally unable to get get out of bed). I’m not sure exactly what it is that made this particular show such a hit for me, especially considering how critical I can get about film (huge movie buff). But I digress. I can only stress that the titles not be a source of judgement when reading this as the translations likely play a huge role in how corny they can sound:  Title: Playful Kiss (Mischievous Kiss) Year: 2015 Seasons (#): 1 Episodes (#): 16 Episode Length: 60 min Plot: This Dramedy tells a tale of the slow-bubbling romance between a sunny student and her popular classmate.  TV Series Trailer (YouTube) | Season 1 Apart from how unbelievably beautiful Ha Ni (Jung So Min) is, the dynamic between herself and classmate Seung Jo (Kim Hyun Joong) was perfect. Nothing can be cause for ruining the potential of a show then when the leads can’t quite click together. But that is not the case here. The episodes are just over an hour long which makes one season more than enough to satisfy any binge watching junkies out there. As of today, the show is still available via the streaming giants so be sure to check it out. There is one final thing to be mentioned regarding this show… and that is not to be deterred by the various remakes that are out there. Japan and Taiwan among others have had success with their own takes on the book, but none of them compare to the Korean version in my opinion. This particular series will always be the absolute #1 favorite to me.  This next one came in as a close #2 for me was this next one which interestingly has been the ONLY series I’ve revisited in order to watch all the way through once more. The leads had great chemistry, Title: My Love From the Star Year: 2013 Seasons (#): 3 Episodes (#): 21 Episode Length: 60 min Plot: Do Min-Joon is an alien who landed on Earth 400 years ago during the Joseon Dynasty period. He possesses a near perfect appearance and enhanced physical abilities involving his vision, hearing and speed. Do Min-Joon has held a cynical view regarding human beings… until he falls for actress Cheon Song-Yi.  TV Series Trailer (YouTube) | Season 1 - Episode 1 Jeon Ji Hyeon made this one what it was in my opinion. There is a particular scene which remains with me to this day. It was just a brief 10 second part where she mocks the American language and apologizes for whatever reason by saying “Sorrry” as she breaks out of Korean for just a moment. She completely pulls off the hugely popular actress/idol role and manages to be quite hilarious throughout.  This next one came in as a close #2 for me was this next one which interestingly has been the ONLY series I’ve revisited in order to watch all the way through once more. The leads had great chemistry, Title: Good Doctor Year: 2013 Seasons (#): 2 Episodes (#): 20 Episode Length: 60 min Plot: A young man named Park Shi-On (Joo Won) has Savant Syndrome which manifests through developmental issues. As an adult, Park attains a highly acclaimed Surgeon residency. Dr. Shi-On struggles to communicate effectively despite being one of the hottest prospects for his amazing ability to diagnose pediatric patients in a far more accurate and timely manner than any of his superiors are accustomed to.  TV Series Trailer (YouTube) | Season 1 The performance given by Joo Won as a mentally disabled person is all the reason you should need to watch this one. I am telling you this is one you should not pass up. It didn’t hurt that the show picks up fairly quickly as you find yourself hooked just after viewing the first 20 minutes of episode 1.  OK I know that this was supposed to be my “Top 3″ but I simply could not leave you without being made aware of just one last show. Probably the most drama-oriented of the bunch, and also the series on my list with the strongest chemistry between leads. And yes, it’s another doctor show. But also well worth a watch. Title: Emergency Couple Year: 2014 Seasons (#): 3 Episodes (#): 21 Episode Length: 60 min Plot: It would be best to just trust me with this one, as the plot for Emergency Couple is probably the most dynamic of all my choices. Just know that it follows Jin-Hee (Song Ji-Hyo) and Chang-Min (Choi Jin-Hyuk), recently divorced and unknowingly about to cross paths once again.  TV Series Trailer (YouTube) | Season 1 — Episode 1 I will reiterate how this is one you really just need to watch and appreciate. The viewing experience will be at its finest if you go in for the most part unaware of the plot. The performances by Song Ji-Hyo and Choi Jin-Hyuk were probably #2 if I had to rank this list in such a way. I had seen Choi in a previous show called Gu Family Book (which also might be worth a look) where he essentially played a villain-type role that was rather impressive.  Last but not least is this little gem. Title: It’s OK, That’s Love Year: 2014 Seasons (#): 2 Episodes (#): 16 Episode Length: 60 min Plot: Jang Jae-Yeol (Jo In Sung) is a best-selling author who accidentallly falls for Ji Hae-Soo (Kong Hyo-Jin), a Clinical Psychiatrist. The only problem is that Ji Hae doesn’t want to start dating him!  TV Series Trailer (YouTube) | Season 1 This one has it all. A solid plot with plenty of mystery, great chemistry between the leads and even a few twists throughout. Slightly off topic, but I could not and still cannot get over how attractive Kong Hyo-Jin is. I’d give anything for a chance to take her out. A beautiful, strong minded woman possessing enormous acting talent. This one also probably had the strongest supporting cast with my favorite secondary performance of all time by Lee Gwang Soo as Park Soo Gwang. His role on this show was undoubtably a breakout performance that has led to an entirely original new series currently being made for him to play the lead on. The soundtrack for this one is also particularly noteworthy, as I’ve added much of it onto my phone since.

The Best Korean Drama Series I've watched so far would be: Boys Over Flowers (a Korean remake of Boys Before lowers Japanese drama) Plot: A poor girl named Geum Jan Di saves a boy who was about to fall of the roof of a mega school named Shinhwa High. When she saves him, she was given the honor to attend the rich school. Than there’s Gu Jun Pyo who is the legitimate owner of that school and everything his father owns and names Shinhwa. He unexpectedly falls in love with Geum Jan Di as she is not like every other girls. Also Gu Jun Pyo has elite friends who are rich as well, combined together they are called “Flower four” as they are all four really good looking boys. This drama will always be my favorite forever. Perfect drama to watch. Has comedy, romance, thriller, action and many other moments. 2) Heirs  Plot: A rich guy called Kim Tan who’s mother is a mistress lives in America since he was little by his Step brother Kim Won. Kim tan fell in love with Cha Eun Sang the first time he met her in America. The girl Cha Eun Sang went to America to find her older sister who hasn’t been contacting her and her mother since she was there. The girl was the sole reason why Kim Tan came back to Korea. This drama is worth it because you get to see Lee Min Ho’s incredible acting and cuteness. Lee Min Ho also sang one of the OST songs in this drama. 3) Fated to love you  Plot: An ordinary soft woman named Jang Na-Ra accidentally drank a beer like bottle which unknowingly contains a strong medicine for making a person lose consciousness and to get pregnant easily. Without knowing it, she accidentally goes to a different hotel room which the main guy named Jang Hyuk is sleeping. Jang Hyuk who was already drowsy from getting drunk due to his broken heart, his girlfriend caused him, they both slept together. Next morning they knew what they did unconsciously and decided to part ways but as fate would have it they met again and in a different circumstance this time. The girl is pregnant with Jang Hyuk’s child. Jang Hyuk is the owner of a large company. This drama is worth watching, it has the most hilarious moments, as well as really sad moments which you’ll 100% cry. It also has the most cute, lovable moments in which you’ll just want to ship them. 4) My Lovely Girl  Plot: Lee Hyun-wook (Rain) is the CEO of a talent agency that scouts and trains idols. He is a brilliant composer-producer who appears cold and indifferent on the outside but is sensitive and kind-hearted. Hyun-wook lives in great difficulty as he is unable to let go of his ex-girlfriend who died in an accident he witnessed first hand 3 years previously. His ex-girlfriend's sister, Yoon Se-na (Krystal), moves to Seoul in order to pursue her music-composing career and meets Hyun-wook who helps her achieve it. Hyun-wook replaces his father (Park Yeong-gyu) as the president of ANA Entertainment, bringing him challenges and conflicts in his career as a president, with trainees, company promotions, his love life and Se-na. In the midst of healing each other through music, they fall in love. I personally love this drama because Krystal is in it. She doesn’t come in a lot of drama’s but when she does i’m there to watch it. 5) She was pretty  Plot:When Ji Sung Joon was young he was fat and ugly while the girl Kim Hye Jin was pretty on the inside and out, they were both friends in their young days but then Ji Sung Joon had to leave for America and Hye Jin was left behind to remember her good friend. Then years passed they grew into adults, Park Seo Joon became a diligent director and also became fit and handsome while Hye Jin was the complete opposite. This drama is so good. Amazing plot. Those are my top 5 dramas I've watched and would recommend.Happy Watching!!

Well I have loved all the dramas I have seen so far.. The girl will have a crush on that boy and his they get together is the story. It's awesome. And Kim Hyun Joong js the hero who is so handsome…Boys over Flowers - Same story. A rich boy who is very arrogant.. His family owns the school. A poor girl who also comes to the same school to study because of her courageous act. Most of the drama takes place in the school and it's fun to watch.Rooftop Prince - Period drama.. A prince will come to the present from past to find out about the death of his princess.. How he copes with the modern world and how he finds the truth is the story.My Girl - A rich guy who owns a hotel will be having a sick grandfather. He will find a poor girl to act like his cousin. Then they will fall in love and what happens then is the story.Personal Taste - A man who wants to know about the architectural designs of a house pretends to be gay to enter the house when the owner would be in need of a roommate.The Heirs - A rich boy falls in love with the daughter of the maid.Pinocchio - A kid will lose his father who is a firefighter. His entire family will become deserted due to the act of a reporter. He will be adopted by a man. The kid will grow up to become a reporter himself.
