Let’s focus with some of the best kdramas of the recent decade. I’m quite picky when it comes to watching KDramas, so it’s indeed something when it merits my praise.  6. The Producers (2015) This is a first of its kind in the Korean drama genres. It features the lives of producer-directors in the Korean entertainment industry, particularly in the variety department. This story focuses on the life of Baek Seung Chan (Kim Soo Hyun), a rookie PD who enters the world of variety shows. This drama also topbills Gong Hyo Jin (from The Master’s Sun), IU (from Dream High), and Cha Tae Hyun (from My Sassy Girl). This is very sure to give you a good laugh. Nonetheless, it has a well developed plot which is well distributed throughout the story.  Plus, you get to see a very cute competitive Baek Seung Chan in this story!  5. The Innocent Man (2012) A guy who was once willingly devoted to do anything for his loved one got the taste of betrayal in the worst way possible after serving years in jail for the crime he took instead of her. He then sets off for his round of revenge. Okay, this one really had me like WTF every end of the episode, because this was no ordinary Cinderella story. The revenge plots are deep, and though the plot devices are too much of a cliché, it kind of worked here. The twists are also shockingly good! For the record, there was no other villain in any korean drama I have watched that I hated more than her (Han Jae Hee played by Park Si Yeon)  It actually means she acted so well the viewers probably hated her so much during those times this show was aired. As the story unfolds, you get to understand her though, that you begin to doubt yourself whether you should really not hate her, or you should just hate her even more. This series stars Song Joong Ki, Park Si Yeon, and Moon Chae Won.  4. Healer (2014–2015) Healer, an infamous night courier, comes across a request from a client searching for this “child”. It turns out that this child, the client, and Healer himself share a common past. For a korean drama series, this is heaping with loads of action and romance! Every episode will take you to the edge of your seat with the twists and developments. The musical score is just too perfect, too!  Another thing to look forward to is the chemistry between Ji Chang Wook and Park Min Young, the two lead stars of this series. This will leave every fangirl speechless and breathless after.  3. Remember: War of the Son (2015–2016) Seo Jin Woo, a high school student, suffers from an ultra rare mental condition called hyperthymesia, which allows him to vividly remember anything from his past to the smallest detail. His father, then suffering from amnesia, was framed of murder, which compels him to study law and become an attorney to clear his father’s name. This drama has a lot of feels. You really would feel sorry for the lead (Yoo Seung Ho as Seo Jin Woo) given the circumstances and the obstacles that prevent him from getting justice. It kind of depicts the kind of corrupt society that we do not wish to happen in our lives. Sure, by his looks alone, a massive fanbase must have grown for this series.  But wouldn’t you feel sorry for him if he passionately cries like this?  This drama also stars Park Min Young. Warning: Don’t get too indulged you might regret feeling the Last Episode Separation Syndrome.  2. Descendants of the Sun (2016) A doctor and a soldier perform duties that are very opposite with each other. Will this obstacle stop them from growing in love with each other, amidst a disaster that draws them closer? I was very skeptical to watch this at first, but as soon as I hopped in, the ride was just awesome. True, the plot wasn’t really a superhuman fictional type, but it was something that captured the audience’s attention. Why so? Because it was something that was amazing. One that takes life for a nationalistic reason, and another that values life above everything else. The dilemma worked effectively. It was also one of those frw dramas that did not require the clichéd tird party characters. This drama also showcases some of the best action stunts! Topbilled by Song Joong Ki And Song Hye Kyo, along with Jin Goo and Kim Ji Won, this 2016 hit is definitely worth a try!  1. You Who Came from the Stars This is definitely my number 1. A haughty toplist actress Cheon Song Yi (Jun Ji Hyun) meets and falls in love with an alien (Kim Soo Hyun) who has been on Earth for the past 400 years.  Jun Ji Hyun slays it. She is the romcom goddess! There was never an episode where she failed to make me laugh! Aside from the romance (which was aso too awesome to handle), the comedy was just phenomenal for a kdrama. Not to mention that Kim Soo Hyun’s acting was very commendable in this drama. The plot was very ell presentedtoo! I couldn’t ask for more in this drama. Well, I haven’t really watched a lot of Kdramas, but in my opinion, of all those that I’ve watched, these are the best. Edit: Okay, so let me just add some recent dramas I have watched, since I have made this answer prior to watching those.  W: Two Worlds (2016) Imagine falling in love with someone you literally can’t reach… i.e. a fictional character. Well, bookworms and otakus can relate so well to that. But what if the tables turn and it goes the other way around? Now, it’s the fictional character falling in love with the realmone. Jus how coll and exciting is that? You wouldn’t get enough with this extraordinary love story with a mysterious twist! Who wouldn’t love that?  Topbilled by Hallyu king Lee Jong Suk and Dong Yi herself Han Hyo Joo, this is not your ordinary comic kdrama, nor is it another “manga-turned-drama” story (I’m sorry for the pun, for those who understand). Any kdrama fanatic would say its plot is one-of-a-kind; being fast paced, not too overly dramatic, but can still be very effective at catching people’s hearts at crucial plot points. It is also way effective in making the viewers engage at the tip of their seats without making them bored. The twists are jaw dropping, ‘nuff said. I really wouldn’t want to say more as spoiling the tiniest bit of the story would really change the way you would see the story.  Lately, the lineup of kdramas has been so phenomenal it is so hard to choose what to watch.

Yes, I do watch Korean dramas and I just love it. I started watching it during my college years and it still continues. I would say, it is the best healer. I watch some of it repeatedly and it has never failed to soothe my soul. I loved some dramas to the core. I have watched many English series too but Korean dramas have always been my priority. Let me rank them according to my liking! 1. Gentlemen’s Dignity - I went through some of the answers to this question but I don’t understand why nobody mentioned this. This is the best drama I have ever seen. It is the story about four friends who are in their 40’s still trying to grow up. They are all so childish in their behavior which is so adorable. Jang Dong-Gun has nailed it. Music was the best. It is so addictive. 2. My girlfriend is a Gumiho - This is a fantasy series. A Nine-tailed fox which was trapped in a painting is been released by the hero and she follows him everywhere. Since she is so naive, the hero helps her. Later they fall in love with each other. Shin Min-ah is the best cast and I don’t think anyone can replace her. 3. Strong women Do Bong Soon - This one is a fantasy series and one of the best. The female lead is blessed with strongness. But the power is also cursed that she can use it only for doing good to people. If she uses it against innocent, then she will lose the power. I loved the way the hero gets all shy when she flirts with him. I also loved a character Oh Dong-Byung who is a transgender who loves the hero. The scenes were hilarious. I would list the other series which I liked. 4. Master's Sun 5. You are beautiful 6. Secret Garden 7. Boys over Flowers 8. To the Beautiful you 9. Playful Kisses 10. 49 days 11. Oh my ghost 12. My princess 13. My love from another star There are some series which I liked but i totally forgot their name.

I suggest: If We Were A Season This is one of my faves of all time! And I would never get tired of watching it again and again. They were childhood friends and secretly admired each other. But they stopped being friends for a while. Until an incident came, linking them back together.They never admitted their feelings to each other. Yes, it does seem cliché at first but as you dig deeper and watch, you’ll feel anger, emptiness, and sadness for the two. It’s bittersweet! The ending will make you whimper in tears. Just come back and thank me when you’re done ;) I’ll give you a hint of the story: [Hye rim dislikes movies that end with a kiss. Because it seems like it’s already their ending. She prefers hugs because it means there’s more to come. And it isn’t really the end.]  2. Good Doctor  Man, this-This was really- >.< (ugh. I can’t even explain the pain I felt!)It had me crying for hours! Shion is an autistic savant who became a pediatrician and tries to prove himself in the face of conflict with patients and peers. A lot of people underestimated him because of his condition when he was a total genius. Good Doctor is a very heartwarming drama that highlights one man's road to achieve his dream. I never thought that I would be drawn to this drama. I felt like I didn’t want to watch it because it was of medical. But as I’ve stayed and understood the situation, every episode left deeper scars and pain. 3. A Werewolf Boy  I never thought I would love this as well! To be honest, I am NOT a fan of werewolf stories and films. I ran out of kdramas to watch and stumbled on this and thought maybe I could give it a try. At first, I was like, okay, yeah, so what, then? yep, he’s half-werewolf, what’s new? But as soon as it ends it totally left me-(ya know already!)  4. Clean With Passion For Now  There’s this CEO who’s germophobic. Even the littlest speck of dust would make him faint if he sees it. And there’s also this girl who’s very messy and always untidy. She’s desperate for work but none accepts her. She had no choice but to work for a cleaning service - which was owned by that germophobic guy. Her father worked for a cleaning company also but was stopped FOR A REASON (find it out yourself). So, Oh-sol had to keep it a secret to her father. But an unexpected romance blooms and- (I don’t wanna spoilll haha). If you liked this kind of drama well, you have to watch the next one! (number 5) 5. I Am Not A Robot I love this drama a lot! It’s all in one! The chemistry’s there, the music, their dialogues, the plot... It was in fact, AMAZING!  In which, a girl named Jia had an affair with an inventor but they split up due to- (Nah. Find that yourself also). This inventor made up a human-robot that looks a lot like Jia, named, Aji 3. Jia becomes entangled in a strange love triangle after pretending to be a robot that looks exactly like her to a person who has an allergy to human contact. But… what will happen if Mingyu finds out that he’s been with a real person the whole time? The robot that he patted with his bare hands? The robot that he held? The robot that made him feel crazy because he thinks he’s in love with that stupid robot? WATCH TO FIND OUT MORE :)))  If you’re finding for a kdrama that has it all like this one, ya better watch the next one too! (number 6) 6. Goblin Of course, this one is also my favorite.This drama made me feel all sorts of emotions! Although some doesn’t like it since it’s about powers and non-existent things.. But if you’re like me then you would totally love this! ALL. IN. ONE.  Goblin is a fantasy romance about a modern-day goblin who seeks to end his cursed immortal life and needs a human bride to do so. His life then becomes intertwined with a grim reaper who is unable to remember his past. But when the goblin finally finds his bride, he suddenly realizes he wants to live and be with her. Goblin is an epic tale with a story that spans centuries. It was quite an interesting ride filled with some amazing characters, talented actors, and a fresh and unique story woven beautifully throughout each episode. Visually, Goblin is absolutely stunning. And so much detail went into setting up the shots and individual scenes. It was all done very artistically. The drama also filmed several scenes in Canada that featured some breathtaking scenery.  The thing I love about this is, apart from the romantic scenes that literally hit me, it has a lot of funny and thrilling scenes! Like I’ve said: ALL IN ONE!It will make you smile, laugh, cry, annoyed, then suddenly, you’ll just feel chills around your body. 6. Strong Woman Do Bong-SoonThe picture tells it all! Well not really all.. there’s so much to discover and for you, to unfold. This is also one of my faves <3 WHO WOULD’VE THOUGHT A GIRL THIS SMALL COULD CARRY A—    Do Bong-Soon was born with superhuman strength—a gift that’s passed down to all the women in her family tree. Her dream is to create a video game with her as the main character, which is why she is ecstatic about landing a job as the CEO’s bodyguard at Ainsoft, a popular gaming company. CEO Ahn Min-Hyuk has been receiving anonymous threats because he’s next in line to take over his father’s other company. Meanwhile, there has been a series of kidnappings in Bong-Soon’s neighborhood. One of the lead investigators is Bong-Soon’s childhood friend, Guk-Doo who she is secretly in love with. Eventually, all three join forces to solve these crimes, and their relationships shift. VOTE FOR MORE KDRAMA SUGGESTIONS! I STILL HAVE A LOT IN MIND!

Bonjour, looking for a good kdrama 1.Goblin - fantasy, romance drama No. of episodes - 16  Kim Shin (Gong Yoo) is a goblin and protector of souls. He is the landlord of the grim reaper (Lee Dong-wook) who is in charge of taking deceased souls. Shin doesn't want immortality anymore but needs a human goblin's bride in order to end his long life. Meanwhile, Ji Eun-tak (Kim Go-eun) is a high school student who despite her painful reality, remains optimistic. She summons the goblin by chance and through various encounters, ends up falling in love with him. Sunny (Yoo In-na) is an owner of a chicken wing shop, a woman who is loved by all men. These four people's lives change when they encounter and their lives become entangled. 2.The legend of blue sea Genre - fantasy romance No. of episodes - 20  The television series centers on the love story of Heo Joon-jae (Lee Min-ho), the son of a rich businessman who becomes a handsome and clever con-man after his parents' divorce, and a mermaid named Shim Cheong (Jun Ji-hyun). Focusing on rebirth, fate, and unrequited love, their tale is juxtaposed with the parallel story of their Joseon era incarnations, town head Kim Dam-ryeong and the mermaid Se-hwa. 3.Kill me heal me Genre- romantic comedy, suspens, medical drama. No. of episodes - 20  The human body is capable of all sorts of things to survive difficult situations. Cha Do Hyun (Ji Sung) is a third-generation business heir who developed dissociative identity disorder (previously known as multiple personality disorder) in the aftermath of several life-threatening traumatic events. He tries to regain control over his life with the help of Oh Ri Jin (Hwang Jung-eum), a first-year psychiatric resident who helps him secretly. But Ri Jin’s twin brother, Oh Ri On (Park Seo-joon), is a writer who is determined to uncover the unscrupulous lives of the rich and starts following Do Hyun around. Can Do Hyun take control over his condition before one of his seven personalities takes control of him instead? 4.While you were sleeping Genre - romance , fantasy, thriller, legal drama No. of episodes - 32  Hong-joo (Bae Suzy) lives with her mother and helps her run a pork restaurant. Hong-joo is haunted by seeing the future deaths of others in her dreams. What's worse is that she does not know when the deaths will happen, but she tries to stop her dreams from becoming reality. Meanwhile, Jae-chan (Lee Jong-suk) is a rookie prosecutor. He meets Yoo-bum (Lee Sang-yeob) at the prosecutors’ office. Yoo-bum was Jae-chan’s private tutor when Jae-chan was in his adolescence, but an unfortunate incident caused Jae-chan to dislike him. Yoo-bum was a prosecutor, but he now works as a lawyer. He takes on any case that brings him money. Jae-chan and his younger brother move to new house and they become neighbors with Hong-joo. One night, Jae-chan dreams that Yoo-bum drives Hong-joo's car and this leads to a chain of events including the death of Hong-joo's mother and then Hong-joo. When Jae-chan senses that his dream is about to become real, he takes extreme actions to stop it. Yoo-bum becomes furious at Jae-chan, but Hong-joo hugs him and thanks him. In the aftermath of the incident, Jae-chan and Hong-joo cross paths and work together to solve other cases. 5.“W” two united worlds  Genre - fantasy, romance ,suspense, thriller. No. of episodes - 16 Cardiothoracic surgeon Oh Yeon Joo's (Han Hyo-joo) father mysteriously goes missing while writing the last chapter of his webtoon "W". Yeon Joo goes to his office and is shocked to see a scene of the dying Kang Chul (Lee Jong-suk), the main character of W, on her father's computer. While reading a note left behind by her father, a hand from the monitor pulled her in and she finds herself on the rooftop of a building next to a bleeding man. She manages to save him and realizes that the person she saved was Kang Chul. Yeon Joo later discovers that she can only leave the webtoon based on Kang Chul's change in feelings. When that happens, the words 'to be continued' will appear and she will teleport back to the real world. 6.The heirs Genre - romance flim, drama ,adolescence. No. of episodes - 20  Cha Eun Sang and her disabled mother take up humiliating jobs such as washing dishes to support her older sister's studies in America. She is fed up of her dull life in Korea. 7.The bride of habeak  Genre -romance , fantasy , comedy No. of episodes - 16 When the narcissistic water god Ha-baek (Nam Joo-hyuk) visits earth in order to find a stone powerful enough to help him claim his throne, he seeks out the help of his servant and destined bride, psychiatrist So-ah (Shin Se-kyung), whose family is fated to serve the water god for generations. The problem is that she has no belief in the gods and initially mistakes him for suffering from delusions. Things get even stranger when the wind god Bi-ryeom (Gong Myung), the water goddess Mu-ra (Krystal), and the semi-god Hu-ye (Lim Ju-hwan) show up to complicate things. 8.The bride of the century  Genre - comedy , romance , fantasy , melodrama. No. of episodes - 16 Taeyang Group is the largestconglomerate in South Korea. The Choi family who runs Taeyang has supposedly been under a curse for a hundred years that the first bride of the eldest son will always die. When the wealthy heiress Jang Yi-kyung (Yang Jin-sung) disappears right before her wedding to chaebol heir Choi Kang-joo (Lee Hong-gi), Na Doo-rim (Yang Jin-sung), a lookalike impostor, is brought in to take her place. Unlike the cold and calculating Yi-kyung, Doo-rim is sweet and sunny, and Kang-joo genuinely falls in love with her. As the wedding plans progress, Kang-joo and Yi-kyung's mothers both scheme and plot behind the scenes. 9. The Masters sun  Genre - romance, fantasy ,comedy ,horror mystery. No. of episodes - 17 Joo Joong-won (So Ji-sub) is the cold and distant CEO of Kingdom, aconglomerate that includes a major department store and hotel. He meets the gloomy Tae Gong-shil (Gong Hyo-jin), who started seeing ghosts after an accident. Their lives take a new turn as they discover whenever Gong-shil touches Joong-won the ghosts that surround her disappear; after much pleading from Gong-shil to allow her to stay by Joong-won's side in return she must help him recover a fortune that was stolen from him during a kidnapping attempt. 10. Oh my ghost  Genre - romance comedy drama thriller . No. of episodes - 16 Na Bong-sun (Park Bo-young) has an extremely timid personality and low self-esteem, doesn't have any close friends, and is constantly getting reprimanded at her job as an assistant chef at Sun Restaurant. She also occasionally sees ghosts, thanks to a shamangrandmother. One day, Bong-sun getspossessed by a lustful virgin ghostnamed Shin Soon-ae (Kim Seul-gi). To make up for the lack of romance in her short life and believing that only by losing her virginity will she be able to "resolve her grudge" and move on to the afterlife, Soon-ae is determined to seduce as many men as she can by possessing various women, and she finds the perfect vessel in Bong-sun. Bong-sun's boss is arrogant star chef Kang Sun-woo (Jo Jung-suk), whom she secretly has a crush on. Sun-woo hasn't dated anyone since getting his heart broken by his college friend Lee So-hyung (Park Jung-ah), who's a TV producer. But when Bong-sun seemingly gets rid of her shyness and suddenly changes into a confident, dynamic woman, she finally catches his eye. Meanwhile, the mystery surrounding Soon-ae's death involves Sun-woo's brother-in-law, a kind police officer, Choi Sung-jae (Lim Ju-hwan), who may not be what he seems.

⁹(It's gonna be super long since I want to pretend like I am a professional writer XD so bear with me, please. If you don't want to read either the description or spoilers (I might slip accidentally) you can simply scroll to see the pictures ^_^) I'll be listing 15-20 dramas which I love the most. I can't shorten the list more as the mentioned ones have touched my heart in a different way and I can never forget the story and characters. They aren't in particular order. ☆ Chicago Typewriter:-  The story is about a famous writer who receives an old typewriter and his fan girl who actually became his anti-fan because of his stuck up, ungrateful attitude. It involves an interesting character, the ghost who acts like a ghost writer because male lead is suffering from writer's block. The only twist, the story of freedom fighters he wrote is real and he and both the main couple are related to each other in their past lives. I initially didn't see the drama because I thought it's a period drama that will become super dark and ignored it for a year. My bad. The ghost and the male lead has this whole new level of bromance where ghost always pull tricks on him. The relationship between male and female lead is sweet and bitter but they manage to work it out while understanding and healing each other. I also liked how they even showed the troubles those freedom fighters, specially the main characters go through with no guarantee of making it out alive. Those feelings still hit me hard. Also, this drama is the one who made the OSTs playing in the background more powerful. Cinematography and aesthetics were perfect.  ☆ Hotel Del Luna:-  It's a horror based rom-com drama filled with fantasy stuffs everywhere. The story is about a woman who is the CEO of a hotel ‘Del Luna’ who serves dead people before they head to the afterlife. She's stuck in our realm but this changes when she appoints a human manager. I have a special thing for reincarnation or previous life stories, I guess. Yes, our female lead is also stuck in the past because she had been betrayed but it's the human manager who eases her guilt and pain and she finally goes to afterlife. Though what I like about this is not only the leads but also the relationship and bonding between the main and supporting characters. Everyone has a story and everyone contributes to the story. They also solve the grudges of dead souls so every episode deals with their tear jerking stories as well. Everything is eye-pleasing here from aesthetics to costumes to OSTs which fits well the situation the characters face and will make you cry. It really feels like a fantasy story though it's not jump scare kind of horror. The drama discusses the death in a bit lighter way but it's worth a shot. I did dropped this one in middle before picking up again and I am glad I did.  ☆ Sky Castle:-  Where to start with this drama? This is one of the best dramas out there which falls in satire, dark comedy genre. This is about four elite families living in high class society called ‘Sky Castle'. It shows what great length parents go through to get their kids get admitted to one of the top universities, from hiring tutors illegally to pressuring their own kids and ignoring their mental health and controlling them. This drama also shows the pain of the kids who go through the cut throat competition of academics, with their will power, dreams, teenage years being crushed upon by their parents expectations. I like the premise so much. Despite not going through this myself but as an Indian, I know this leads to mental issues and suicide among school kids and college students. The plot is tightly written that kept me on edge every time because I was so worried about the kids and felt so bad for them. The OSTs only added more fear in my mind (whenever it played, I knew something's bad gonna happen) as I watched the story took sharp, mind numbing turns. What I also liked on the drama is, it also shows the side of adults and their perception too and give their characters the chance to redeem. Overall, I would say, I never was bored in it for a second and every character is memorable.  ☆ Mystic Pop-up bar:-  This short 12 episode drama has been recently aired in May-June 2020 and falls under fantasy drama with reincarnation and death theme (I know my choice in drama isn't that diverse). The elements are similar to Hotel Del Luna with the female lead trying to resolve the grudges but in this, she does it for living people by going in their dreams. She is stuck on earth for 500 years and has to complete the deadline of resolving 100 thousand people in a month. She with her partner who is an officer of after life police teams up with a guy who has psychic powers to complete her target. It is very light-hearted, funny drama and it actually shows the after life world a lot more times, in a very creative way The trio is very interesting to watch as they do hilarious things during their grudge solving missions. They all have a very warm and amazing dynamic and I kept watching it just for them. The writing is sleek and story moves smoothly with all the dots of the puzzle connected well. Though the story was predictable, I had fun watching it and even though the drama is not anything extraordinary but I'll watch it again for characters, acting, story and comedy.  ☆ Circle:-  Circle is the first true sci-fi drama produced in Korea (they do make sci-fi dramas but this drama takes the whole cake for being the true one). This 12 episode drama is actually divided into two parts i.e. it shows two different stories. First part is of 2017 which follows a college student who investigates the mysterious death in his campus while the second part is about a detective in 2037 who goes to ‘Smart Earth' (a crime-free city made separately for people who can afford living there) to investigate kidnapping case. What I like about this is, it's totally unpredict9able. It's filled with alien technology, advanced human technology, hi-tech gadgets, illegal experiments, murders, mystery and an alien too. This drama uses the ‘Human Memory' as the center of the drama and shows how our memory makes us the individuals we are and how we are nothing without it. It explores the idea of ‘No memory, No emotions, No pain' very well. One other thing that kept me hooked and made it memorable are the characters themselves. They made me laugh and cry for them, especially the longing and yearning of brothers was too much for me to handle. It was a perfect drama for me however it ends with an open ending so I low key wish a sequel. ;)  ☆ Signal:-  Signal is a story about a criminal profiler from Cold case department in 2017 who finds an old walkie talkie which connects him to another detective from the past i.e. 1997. Using this, both of them try to solve the case they have in their hands and this changing the past and present. This drama is one of the best dramas in kdrama history written so smartly and uses the time travel theme efficiently without a single loophole in the plot. I was never bored, not at all. Every case they solve teaches the characters something while they deal with their own personal life regrets and internal conflicts. I was amazed every time new twist used to come in the story. The big expected twist was, they were connected from the past but in a very interesting way. Obviously it doesn't have the romance plot too (well, there's a bit of it but it never came true so…) but it's not the problem here. You won't even notice that. You will only notice the acting which is first class and would cry for them as they go through the pain themselves. I did and I cried for the dead big brother of 2017 detective for whom he became the detective (to prove his innocence).  ☆ Prison Playbook:-  Prison Playbook is a story about a star baseball player who gets convicted after he assaults a guy, who tries to rape his sister, ends up in coma (I know, the laws of Korea seems to be messed up in these kdramas). He goes to prison for a year and the drama follows him and shows how his life changes as he meets different people with different backgrounds and different personalities. It is a bit lengthy (20 episodes, each episode is 1.5 hours) but it didn't stop me to kept watching it because this drama showed me, it's not necessary to have jaw-dropping turns in the story to watch a drama and make it successful. It might be a bit odd to hear I saw prisoners doing mundane, everyday things in the entire drama but it's the main charm of the drama. The beauty of this drama lies in the characters themselves. Every character is freshly engraved in my memory. All have their own back story and it showed their struggles, how they fail and how they overcome after trying again and again in their life. Like normal human beings. I lived their lives with them. The OSTs just add extra charm to it (I don't hear many OSTs but I ended up downloading this drama's because it made me do so).  ☆ Angry Mom:-  Angry Mom is another family based funny drama that I love and I end up watching it's short clips again and again. This drama is about a mom who was a rule breaker and used to get into street fights when she was 18. Now when she saw her own child getting bullied and being beaten up in school, she goes to her school posing as a high schooler as authorities doesn't take actions. This one shows and tackles the serious issues like bullying, delinquent students, school corruption by mixing it with comedy. It might seem weird to many but to me, it is the only relief and I was willing to watch it. Mom would go around with her bold and fearless attitude and tries to find evidences to get her daughter justice. It not only ensured unexpected hilarious events and situations but also make other students to not create more problems and change for the better. Though, at the end, I didn't get to see the romance (it was one sided but for the first time, I regretted to not have any), it was worth my time as I laughed so much all the time and became the part of the mom and daughter's journey. Though it also shows how corruption is deeply rooted in the schools and how they might prioritize reputation of the institution above student's life and might be busy laundering money for own personal gain.  ☆ Are you human too?:-  Are you human too? is a romantic-comedy drama with a robot theme. The story is about a rich 3rd generation chaebol who gets into accident while on his search for her mother and falls into coma. Her mother, who is a scientist, replaces him with her own developed human like robot whose design is based on her son so that he could protect her son's place in his grandfather's company. I love this drama to bits and have already watched it 3 times (I don't repeat a drama once I finish it. There are only 3 dramas I re-watched again.). I have seen people who can't watch it because of the love story between a human and a non-human and I understand it all too well. It's almost impossible but then love has different definitions for everyone and there are different kind of love. I find it beautiful because it is not bound to body attraction and the love and care female lead show for the male lead have a unique effect on his ever upgrading artificial intelligence. I felt so proud to watch a smart robot, who doesn't know a thing about cruelty of humans and their complex nature, learns and develop on his own and changes everyone's lives around him at the end of the drama. The story is simple but the characters make it special and breathe life to the drama. The acting is simply superb (specially the male lead who switches from jerk human to kind robot in an instant), the cinematography is beautiful, story flows beautifully and OSTs are a blessing.  ☆ The Cursed:-  The Cursed is a horror, supernatural mystery thriller which tells the story about the reporter who is trying to dig deep into an IT company for its suspicious activities. During this, she met a high school kid who can cast curse (basically kill the person) through her supernatural powers. She offers to help her as both of them find the CEO of the same IT company being involved in murders and shamanism. I love this. It is spooky not enough to haunt me in night (I can't watch horror movies at all but I can't tel for others). It's not that unpredictable but what I really liked about it is, how fast paced and smartly written this drama was. I don't think there are many horror dramas which has evil spirits trying to kill the entire country while trying to spread throughout the world. The entire plot surrounds this single purpose and I got to see the real fight between evil spirit and the curse caster. The cast is simply superb and the atmosphere throughout the drama gives off the dark, serious, doomed atmosphere.  ☆ Your honor:-  Your honor is a comedy, court room drama with a simple romantic plot at the side. It is about two twin brothers, one is a judge and the other is a petty criminal. The judge got kidnapped one day and his brother replaces him under strange circumstances and becomes the judge. This drama is a full package of romance, mystery thriller, court room drama, bad relationship with brother and less caring mother and cool OSTs. I love how this drama showed the role of a judge I never ever thought about. How he is important and how he holds the power to either save or destroy the victim's family. It deals with good cases, though not every case gets justice (of course the criminal male lead is here for money too in the start) as the male lead changes from greedy to considerate. The female lead plays a big role in his change as a good, supporting trainee under him and I love her for that. She isn't over the top and is sweet and understanding equally. This drama also has its own hilarious moments and the male lead (Yoo Shi Yoon) just nails the dual role.  ☆ Life on Mars:-  The story is about a forensic expert who trusts evidences and the data he collects over anything else. When the girl he likes goes missing after he accidentally releases him, he meets with the accident during his search and ends up in the past as a detective. Now, he tries to get back to the present while solving the cases that he and his new team faces everyday. Honestly, this drama is slow and has a depressing and serious kind of tone throughout the story. You might not be interested in this story at first. But that's where you're gonna miss it. I liked how detailed everyday life of the past was shown. Everyone acted so well, especially Jung Kyung Ho and Park Sung Woong clearly portrayed the characters well. I could feel the tension of the detective and can feeling of urgency and ‘everything is at stake’ kept swirling in my brain. The bonding was strong and family-like, I would cry if anything happens to anyone of them. The ending morale of the case they come up with forces you to think out of the box. This drama blurs the line of reality and imagination and forces you to draw your own conclusion of what's right and what's wrong at the end.  ☆ Moments at 18:-  This slice of life drama is one of the sweetest thing you would ever come across. This drama is about a new transfer student Joon Woo who meets with the girl Soobin on his first day to school. He is a quiet kid who appears like he doesn't care about anyone and lives like there's no tomorrow but he is just a normal kid who earns his own keep and has a troubled family and life. Slowly, he opens up with Soobin, who is understanding and caring and gives him a chance despite what others say. As they fall in love, we see all ups and down of what a normal 18 year old faces in his or her life. I love the character of Joon Woo and Soobin, actually I love all the characters, whether they are good or bad. It's a well-written drama with simple storyline. It has no extra drama or cliche scenes but it feels real. Though I couldn't relate to the life these kids had (I have no life), I still loved how simple, sweet and realistic it looked. The bullying, discrimination and struggles Joon Woo faces as he runs multiple part time jobs, I learned to thank what I already have. Even though Soobin has everything, she knew how to be grateful and considerate. She knew how to stand for right and wrong without being arrogant and I learned this from her. You can even learn something from Hwi-Young, the negative character of the drama who is actually the result of bad parenting, who at the end learns bullying is wrong and it's okay to loose and not come first. I am sure you'll gonna fall in love with everyone on board.  ☆ Crash Landing on You:-  Crash Landing on You is a story about a businesswoman who while paragliding get stuck in the storm and unfortunately ends up landing in North Korea. There, she is found out by a North Korean soldier. He along with his team helps her to hide and takes the charge to take her safely to South Korea. It's a romantic comedy and honestly, I am glad I watched it. It has everything from beautiful shots to costumes. The actors potrayed their roles amazingly with Hyun Bin stealing the show with his gentleman and kind behaviour and Ye Jin potraying the lady who is strong, independent, street smart and equally compassionate and kind. It was amazing to see them grow together and understand each other world by literally living in it. The team and its members had this strong bond and were like a family to each other and they helped our leading couple equally. I also loved the second lead couple (and I guess everyone who watched it loved them as well). Every other side characters were written well and had their own story to tell. I was never bored. The lives of North korean might not be potrayed accurately but it was still quite real. It was interesting to see villages to the politics that goes in there. OSTs once again, was beautiful.  ☆ High School, Love on!:-  The story is about an death angel Seulbi, who after accidentally saving a human 18 year old student Woohyun, ends up becoming a human herself. She ends up living with Woohyun, as his grandmother accepts her into the family because she doesn't remember anything and saved his grandson's life. Now, despite it's flaws (by others, I don't see flaws because I enjoy it more), I really love how the story progresses and how the characters who dislike and fight each other, ends up bonding together and find a way to live their lives. Since it has fantasy elements, you are gonna see problems related to Seulbi's powers too. The writers really blended in the fantasy elements to the problems and things high schooler faces like death of a family member, loneliness, trust in friendship and teenage puppy love. The OST's are beautiful, actors are pretty good (especially Kim Sae Ron), they have lot of comedy scenes and some real family problems and overall pretty cool school life scenes which are enough to remind you of your school days.  ☆ Hwayugi/ A Korean Odyssey:-  The story is about a monkey God who is trapped and tricks a little psychic girl into releasing him from the prison. The little girl, who thought he would protect him from ghosts when he calls his name, grows up without remembering his name. Fate makes them meet again and after many ups and downs, they fall in love again. When it comes to fantasy and adventure rom-com that involves mystical creatures like Gods and demons, this drama is the best for me. It involves everything- a bull, a monkey, a pig, a zombie, a dog, a ghost, a dragon too. Every episode is filled with adventure/mystery and your couple solving them while they work on their own feelings for each other. But this was not the only memorable thing for me. It has tons of comedy scenes plus it has variety of characters and their interactions with each other is what I lived for. I loved everyone of them. The story is balanced with fantasy, adventure, bromance, fight, romance and comedy. I wouldn't talk more in depth because I might give out the entire story in order to explain what I loved more about it.  ☆ Bing goo:-  Bing goo is actually a 2 episodes long drama which is about a man (Kim Jung Hyun) who is kind and compassionate and has a girl who loved him and he loved her to death. However, by unexplained phenomenon, he gets transported from 1979 to the present day and meets a girl who looks like the girlfriend of his best friend. She helps him to find the girl he loves while adjusting to the current world. This drama is short but it had me in tears. I rarely cry a river in dramas and this kdrama was the first to do so. It doesn't have a sad ending but I was so attached to the main lead, I feared he doesn't have a sad ending. This drama is short and yet it knows what to focus on. It's not a sci-fi or fantasy drama but a romance drama which beautifully potrays the unconditional love. Our leading man is kind and understanding and this changed the people around him too. But what I loved about this drama is the dedication and commitment he had for the only girl he loved in his life. He might appear like a fool but to me, he is someone who can even sacrifice himself for the happiness of his love, without any conditions. That's the reason he tried to understand her when he met her again. Now, I won't reveal much because it's already a short drama.  ☆ My Holo love:-  This 12 episode drama ventures into science fiction and includes artificial intelligence along with being a romance drama. The story revolves around a woman who is lonely (because she has insecurities due to her face-blindness and doesn't socialize) and wishes for an emotional support. One day, she finds a pair of glasses in her bag and surprisingly after wearing it, she is greeted by a human looking like male AI that can be seen only through the glasses. The story is not complicated. It is simple and felt more real to me. What I like about this drama is how beautifully it incorporates the artificial intelligence theme to the human life. The characters in the drama including the leading man (Yoon Hyun Min), leading lady (Ko Sung Hee) have a very detailed characterisation and they are written and presented well. The Holo (also played by Yoon Hyun Min) is the person who helps them confront their insecurities, regrets and fears of the past. I prefer calling him a person because he feels and behaves more like a human than an actual human does. Not only this, I really like how main lead and female lead grows out of their shell they made and manages to live the life on their own terms, in the end. Other supporting characters are equally simple and good though the main focus is on our couple.  Image credit:- Pinterest

Do I watch Korean Dramas? Of course I do!!! I can practically stay in my room all day because I'm watching a Korean Drama. I'm pretty much addicted and I don't want to be saved. (Of course, I have a level of control. Don't mind my exaggeration up there!!!) Now let's get to the list. There's no ranking in this list. I just mention whatever comes to mind first. There are some dramas that will come like no. 4, 5 or even in the special mentions that I personally like more than the ones in no. 1, so please remember that there's no ranking. Starting with Historical Dramas: Yi San also known as Lee San, Wind of the Palace Starring Lee Seo Jin as King Jeongjo(Yi San) and Han Ji Min as Seong Song Yeon. This drama shows the importance and strength of love, loyalty and friendship. From his friendship with two non-royals, Song Yeon(whom he later falls in love with) and Park Dae Su(who becomes his most trusted soldier) to his loyalty to his subjects. San is a king who likes to go incognito and mingle with his subjects. He is a king who loves practicing martial arts with his soldiers and hates it when others risk their life for his. This drama displays a true King who is completely loyal to his subjects and at the same time is in a struggle as it is hard for him to be with the one he loves. Trust me, if you get emotional easily, there's no way you won't end up with a bit of tears while watching this. From romance, to action to mystery, it has it all. 2. Empress Ki  Starring Ha Ji Won as Ki Seungyang, Jon Jin Moo as Wang Yu and Ji Chang-Wook as Toghon Temür Seungyang is a low class woman born in Goryeo but after going through different struggles, near-death experiences, losing her first love and so on(I don't want to drop too much spoilers) she manages to make her way to the top and becomes the Empress of the Yuan Dynasty. This woman is a perfect description for a strong and independent woman. Beauty, brains and brawn, this woman has it all. 3. Dae Jang Geum  Starring Lee Young-Ae as Jang Geum, Ji Jin Hee as Min Jeong Ho, Hong Ri-Na as Choi Geum Young and so on This drama is about an orphaned girl who from a kitchen maid and then a royal cook becomes the greatest physician and the first female royal physician in the Joseon Dynasty. From accidentally being the cause of her parents death, burying her mother with her own hands, surviving by herself, finding her way into the palace, becoming a kitchen maid and being betrayed by her best friend, Jang Geum goes through a lot right from the beginning. The poster looks boring, I know, but give it a chance. Personally, I think it's worth watching. 4. Gu Family Book  Starring Lee Seungi as Choi Kang Chi, Bae Suzy as Dam Yeo Wool This drama is one that keeps you interested right from the beginning, that is, if you're interested in historical drama mixed with fantasy, action, suspense and romance. It centers on a half human, half gumiho, Choi Kang Chi who finds out the truth of his birth and goes in search of the Gu family book that holds the secrets to becoming human. Of course, the drama that precedes his birth is something that you should definitely watch (I don't want to drop any spoilers). Give this drama a chance, it's definitely worth it. Special mentions: Shine or go crazyMoon Lovers: Scarlet Heart Ryeo(I love this particular one. This is a MUST watch!!!)Mirror of the witchThe Moon Embracing the SunJumong (If you haven't watched this, you better start with this. This is where the beginning of your journey with Kdramas should start from, that is, if you're into historical dramas)Hwarang: The Poet Warrior YouthFaith also known as the Great Doctor as well as the most underrated drama Lee Min Ho has ever starred in.Arang and the Magistrate: Lee Joon Gi and Shin Min-A did a great job with this dramaThe Scholar who walks the nightLove in the moonlight, also known as Moonlight drawn by cloudsThe Princess' Man: Forget the name, this drama is amazing!!!The King's Daughter, also known as Su Baekyhang(Another MUST watch!!!)Warrior Baek Dong SooDong YiSix Flying DragonsThis is as much as I can remember, for now... Now to the dramas set in mostly modern times: You're all Surrounded Starring Lee Seung Gi as Eun Dae Gu/Kim Ji Young, Cha Seung Won as Seo Pan Seok, Go Ara as Uh Soo Sun, Ahn Jae Hyun as Park Tae -Il, Park Jung Min as Ji Gook This rom-action-com centres on five rookie detectives and their leader who work together to solve an 11-year old case. The case involves a missing boy whose mother was murdered. Unknown to them, this missing boy is in their midst and the murderer is very well known and close to them. The drama also centres on friendship, loyalty, trust and finding one's dreams. It's honestly an amazing drama with romance and comedy here and there to lighten the dark aura of the plot. 2. Goblin/Guardian: The Lonely and Great God  Starring Gong Yoo as Kim Shin, Kim Go Eun as Ji Eun Tak, Lee Dong Wook as The Grim Reaper/Wang Yeo, Yoo In-na as Kim Sun I have only four words for you, GO AND WATCH THIS!!! 3. The Beauty Inside  Starring Seo Hyun Jin as Han Se Gye, Lee Min Ki as Seo Do Jae, Ahn Jae Hyun as Ryu Eun Ho, Lee Da Hee as Kang Sa Ra This drama centres on a famous actress and an airline director who both suffer from very weird cases. The actress, Han Se Gye turns into a different person at a certain period every month and lives like that for a week while the airline director, Seo Do Jae suffers from prosopagnia(face blindness). In other words, he can't recognize people's faces. Both of them struggle with keeping their cases a secret while trying to figure what love means to each of them. We also see Ryu Eun Ho, a friend of Se Gye and a very charming young man who is determined to become a priest but this determination begins to fall when he meets Kang Sa Ra, Seo Do Jae's half sister. It's a very interesting drama and I highly recommend it. 4. Birth of a Beauty  Starring Han Ye Seul as Sara, Joo Sang Wook as Han Tae Hee, Jung Gyu Woon as Lee Kang Joon, Wang Ji Hye as Gyo Chae Yeon Sa Geum Ran (Ha Jae Sook) is a woman married to Lee Kang Joon, who has spent the past 7 years in the US doing business. Because she is ‘fat' and ‘embarrassing’ to be around, she is treated terribly by her mother-in-law and sisters-in-law. However, this kindhearted woman still takes care of the whole family. Her husband returns with a mistress, Gyo Chae Yeon, a popular broadcast announcer, and decides to get a divorce. After several things happen, Sa Geum Ran gets involved in an accident that almost costs her her life. She survives and gets plastic surgery from head to toe and returns as South Korea's beauty. Several things take place, she encounters Han Tae Hee, a genius, or so he calls himself, with a sort of mysterious past and a journey of finding her self worth, true love and revenge begins. At first, the drama may seem to body shame women who don't fit to society's standards but dive deeper and you'll see that it's actually sending a message on the importance of self-worth. Special mentions: AthenaGood Doctor(There's even an American drama based on this. It goes by the same name as well).City Hunter, another underrated Lee Min Ho dramaYong Pal, also known as Gang DoctorShopping King LouieOh My VenusMy ID is a Gangnam BeautyYou're Beautiful (Old but gold. I love this drama!!!)Blood (Not a huge fan of the ending but it was a good drama)Strong Woman Do Bong Soon (Another must watch drama)Cinderella and the Four NightsUncontrollably FondHotel Del Luna (A must watch as well!!!)My Girlfriend is a GumihoVagabondMy Secret TerriusThere's also the dramas that Lee Min Ho has acted in, Boys Over Flowers, Legend of the Blue Sea, The Heirs (Not a huge fan of The Heirs but it's still interesting), and so on. In summary, I can't pick the drama that I like the most. They're all amazing. If you haven't watched any drama on this list, you better go and do so.

Oooh this is hard. I don't have favourites but I will list the ones that stood out and remained in my memory most in random orders. 1. Warrior Baek Dong-soo  It's an amazing story about brotherhood and friendship. Struggles, honour, betrayals and bonds. Amazing acting. Played by Ji Chang-wook  as Baek Dong-soo & Yoo Seung-ho  as Yeo Un. Their bromance in the story is amazing. They're polar opposites and the child actors who played them as when they were younger aced their characters as well.  2. I Remember You  It's about serial killers and two brothers separated from a young age. Both brothers are geniuses: one is a lawyer and the other is a criminal consultant/lecturer who also doesn't remember his brother due to the trauma that caused their separation. The drama centers around the mystery of how and why the brothers got separated and the murders that are linked to both of them. The drama is amazing and well thought out as it explores the mind of psychopaths and how they think and why they do what they do. Played by Seo In-guk as Lee Hyun and Park Bo-gum as Jung Sun-ho. I especially liked D.O from EXO's acting skills. He potrayed his character amazingly.  3. Healer  A night courier whose recent job got him entangled in a web of mystery and deceit which was linked to his and a tabloid journalist's pasts. Together, they uncover the truth about their history. Played by Ji Chang-wook as Seo Jung-hoo, Park Min-young as Chae Young-shin and Yoo Ji-tae as Kim Moon-ho. 4. Remember: War of the Son  A boy who has Hyperthymesia, a condition which allows him to have perfect memory and remember everything. His father, who has Alzheimer's, was wrongfully convicted of a murder to which he vowed to prove his father innocence by studying to become a lawyer. He was successful in becoming a lawyer, however, his attempts and work to prove his father's innocence isn't easy as the psychopathic criminal is wealthy and with connection. But his worst obstacle is his deteriorating memory. Played by Yoo Seung-ho as Seo Jin-woo, Park Min-young as Lee In-ah, Nam Goong Min as Nam Gyu-man and Park Sung-woong as Park Dong-ho. 5. You Don't Know Women  Amazing, amazing story. Really. This is one of the first kdramas I've ever watched as it was on tv and after all the years, it still remains as one of the best. Sadly, it's very hard to find online and I haven't found it. If anyone knows where to watch it, please let me know. It's about a lady who, after finding out about her husband's affair and being divorced, she discovered that she is pregnant. The story centers on how she got back on her feet after the mental abuse from her mother in law during her marriage and the emotional pain of being left for a prettier and younger woman. After years passed, she now has a stable career as a business woman and caring for her son alone. A handsome young man enters her life and courted her. It all became twisted however, when she found out the man is the CEO of her ex husband's company. Played by Kim Ji-ho as Lee Min-jung and Go Se-won as Park Moo-hyuk. 6. Descendants of the Sun  The on-screen couple who became couples in real life. A mix of romance, action and comedy, it's a great drama that deserves the attention it got. I actually checked this one out because I was curious to why so many people raved about it and I understood why they did. That's all for my list. There are many more dramas that is great too but this are the ones I can remember at the moment!

this list is based on my personal opinion and so you may or may not agree with it in no particular order… 1.She was pretty A romantic comedy about two past acquaintances who meet again after they've gone through a reversal of fortunes and appearances, set in the backdrop of a fashion magazine's publishing office. this drama is undoubtedly one of the best ever made in 2015 and if you are a person who loves this typical everyday kind of romance, this is a perfect watch!  starring Hwang Jung Eum and Park Seo Joon with the lead roles supported by equally strong characters played by (super junior’s) Choi Siwon and Min Ha Ri…..this drama is a must watch! 2.Healer A decades-old incident involving a group of friends who ran an illegal broadcasting station brings together three different people—an illegal mercenary with the codename "Healer" who happens to possess top-notch fighting skills, a reporter from a second-rate tabloid news website , and a famous journalist at a major broadcast station In trying to uncover the truth from that 1992 incident, they grow into real, honest reporters, and deal with the conflict between the truth and fate. this drama is by far my favorite action/thrileer kdrama i have watched and it is perfect in every aspect!  starring ji chang wook , park min young and yoo ji tae this drama was considered the best for 2014–2015 by kdrama fans all over the world! 3.W-two worlds its a love story of a surgeon who lives in the human world . she gets dragged into the world of a manhwa( korean comic)from time to time and develops a romantic relationship with the lead character/protagonist of the comic.  starring Lee Jong Suk and Han Hyoo Joo in the lead roles this drama is filled with twists and exciting action sequences as well as perfect romantic scenes which leaves you begging for more! my favorite drama for 2016 as of now! 4.Kill Me Heal Me Cha Do Hyun is a third-generation business heir who developed dissociative identity disorder (multiple personality disorder) in the aftermath of several life-threatening traumatic events. He tries to regain control over his life with the help of Oh Ri Jin, a first-year psychiatric resident who helps him secretly. But Ri Jin’s twin brother, Oh Ri On , is a writer who is determined to uncover the unscrupulous lives of the rich and starts following Do Hyun around. Can Do Hyun take control over his condition before one of his seven personalities takes control over him instead? to the best of my knowledge this is the best psychological/romantic kdrama ever made and it covers a wide range of societal behavior and the dark side of rich families/(chaebol families)  starring Hwang Jung Eum, Ji Sung and Park Seo Joon this drama is an emotional roller coaster!. P.S Ji Sung has done a remarkable job portraying 7 different roles( the various personalities) much to an extent that you would not even realise its just one person. 5.Oh My Venus A personal trainer who suffers from an injury is hired by an overweight woman to help her with health issues. As they spend some time together, they fall in love and learn to deal with their problems. this is by far one of the most star studded cast in a kdrama which i have to say is visually perfect with the cast comprising of Shin Mina and So Ji Sub who are undoubtedly the best looking actors in kdrama world.  6.Hwarang: the beginning although this drama has not yet aired and will only air by late december 2016 i know this is gonna be on my list of my all time favorites as the cast comprises of all my favorite actors including two of my biases in kpop the cast consists of Park Seo joon in the lead with (ZE:A’s)Park Hyunsik , SHINee’s Choi minho and Kim Taehyung( more commonly known as V from BTS) this drama is going to be perfect The drama revolves around a group of youths who grow through passion and love in Seorabeol, the capital of the kingdom of Silla (during Silla dynasty)  SPECIAL MENTIONS:-you should watch these as well! Descendants Of The SunOh my ghostTo the beautiful youuncontrollably fondk2Pinocchioits okay its lovecity hunterlucky romancemy love from another star

i breath Korean dramas! i know that was little dramatic thing to say but yes i do. if you ask any kdrama lover, buddy be prepared to get tons of names because its damn hard choose which drama i love the most. however, for your help, i can add few but trust me, my list is never ending!! the beauty inside: the drama is ongoing right now. and i must say , this one is going really good. if you are not watching then pls do. also there is a film with the same name, lucky me i didn't get teh chance to watch. so everything is fine !devilish joy : the sweetest love story that will complete your obsession for love. this drama is seriously cute.ms. hurammabi: damn cool law drama with cute lead characters. not just that, I cant ignore how amazing this drama was and the chemistry between l and go ara is undeniable. this one is good if you like law realted dramassuspicious partner: one of the best and my fav drama. this one is hella good. also i love ji wook and nam ji ‘s chemistry. the drama was amazing when it comes to chemistry , comedy, action , law stuff etc.Romantic doctor : one of the coolest medical drama. if you ever wonder how much doctors can be so cool and badass, pls watch this one.The legends of the blue sea: No comments. just watch itGoblin: dont call yourself a kdrama lover , if you are still missing this one!Jugglers: office romantic drama with crazy leads. i have to say , this one is best thing i ever watchedMask: a different story with some serious drama, also i love the whole emotional ride. if you are bored with romcom stuff, pls watch this. however its a romantic story still you will love itanother miss oh : craziest love story with i dont know what i just watched but i loved it factor. the whole asshole guy turned sweet lover, Erin is the best actor with hottest kisses.

There are a lot of Korean dramas I love .But here are the four of them I loved the most and would recommend to anyone!! 1 . Descendents of the Sun (2016 — Romance,melodrama,action )  This is one of the best dramas ever made. A love story between Captain Yoo Shin Jin and Doctor Kang Mo Yeon who together face danger in a war-torn country. The second leads playing Seargent Sea Dae-young and Lieutenant Yoon Myung-ju also displays great chemistry. Being written by the star writer Kim Eun-sook , the elements of bromance is also at its greatest!In short, this drama has all thats amazing : great cast, wonderful plot and cinematography, star writer and a lot more.If you are new to the world of K-dramas, then this is yours:start from this masterpiece! 2 . Guardian : The Lonely and Great God (2016 - fantasy,romance,melodrama )  This was one of the first dramas I have watched and if you are a person who loves to live in the world of fantasy, then you should really give this drama a go ! The plot revolves around the lives and deaths of a long lived goblin and his bride.With Gong Yoo, Kim Go Eun, Lee Dong Wook, Yoo In-na and Yook Sung-jae in the lead roles, there's a lot for the viewers to expect! 3 . Mr.Sunshine (2018 - history,patriotism,romance,melodrama )  Alert : Nobody leaves without tears after the final episode. This historical drama tells the story of Captain Eugene Choi - a poor Korean boy who ends up in the United States and later returns to his homeland during a historical turning point and Go Ae-sin - the daughter of a aristocrat fighting for the independence of their country.Filled with limitless patriotism and love, this drama is a perfect series with the best cast,direction,cinematography and character development.If you are looking for a touching story with pure affection,then this is yours!! 4 . Crash Landing on You (2019 - romance )  What happens when a South Korean heiress accidentally lands in North Korea and that too in the hands of the North Korean Special Police Force! This story of Ri Jeong-hyuk and Yoon Se-ri clearly conveys the message of love beyond boundaries.With amazing chemistry between the leads and cinematography showing the unique lifestyles of north and south, this drama have attained high viewership ratings!! So these are the ones I love watching again and again.There are many other excellent dramas like Moon Lovers:Scarlet heart ryeo, Hotel Del Luna,Itaewon Class,Strong Woman Do Bong-song,W,Weightlifting Fairy Kim Bok Jo,I'm not a Robot - to name a few!! Hope this helps.

I have watched following series and liked them : Boys Over Flowers : It is modern-day Cindrella tale of a poor, but spunky schoolgirl at an exclusive academy who attracts the interest of the four ultra-rich and ultra-handsome princes of the school known as F4. My favorite Korean drama till now, I still watch the episodes when I get leisure time .Secret Garden : The story is about a crossing of social classes with a department store CEO Kim Joo-won falling for a stunt woman Gil Ra-im.My Love from another Star : It is a romantic fantasy story about an alien who landed on Earth in the Joseon Dynasty and, 400 years later, falls in love with a top actress in the modern era.Personal taste : It is about a furniture designer, Park Kae-in, who lives together with architect Jeon Jin-ho under the mistaken assumption that he's gay.My Girl Friend is A Gumiho : It is romantic comedy television drama about a normal college student, with ambitions of becoming an action star falls in love with gumiho, a legendary fox with nine tails .Jewel in the Palace : Also known as Dae Jang Geum , it tells the tale of an orphaned kitchen cook who went on to become the king's first female physician. It is based on the true story of Jang-geum, the first female royal physician of the Joseon Dynasty.It's Okay, That's Love : Jang Jae-yeol is an author of bestselling mystery novels and a radio DJ. Playful and a bit arrogant, he also suffers from OCD. Ji Hae-soo is a psychiatrist, driven and ambitious with her career yet compassionate towards her patients. She has a negative attitude towards love and relationships in her personal life. Once they meet, there is much contention between them caused by their strong personalities. But slowly their bickering turns into love as they begin to learn how compatible they are.Hidden Identity : An undercover investigative squad of homicide detectives is formed, and their extra-legal methods include wiretapping, communications monitoring and deep cover infiltration.Mackerel Run : The high school sitcom . Series is incomplete story.Arang and the magistrate : The period horror-romance is based on the folklore of Arang, who died unjustly and returns as a ghost in order to reveal the circumstances surrounding her death.Faith : It is about a modern-day plastic surgeon, who gets kidnapped and travels back in time to the Goryeo period, 700 years in the past. There, she meets and falls in love with a warrior, who is the leader of the royal guard.I will add more series after watching new ones. Enjoy!

Boys over flowersIf you are into romantic flicks, you'll love it. It stars Goo-Hye-Seon as Guem-Jan-Di.  Lee-min-ho as Gu-jun-pyo, seems he was born for this role.  and heart throbbing Kim-hyun-joong.  Plot: Boys over Flowers” nails the assignment, more or less. Feisty, unfashionable dry cleaner’s daughter Jan-Di (Gu Hye-Seon) clashes with the rich bullies at a fancy private high school, leading to violent face-offs between the young woman and the whole school. But opposites typically attract in these stories, and to everyone’s surprise, she becomes unlikely girlfriend to the group’s condescending ringleader, Gu Jun-Pyo (Lee Min-Ho). 2. Something in the Rain  This series will melt your heart. The amazing acting of Jung Hae In and Son Ye-jin and the chemistry speaks volumes to the emotional pull. I, as a viewer am experiencing. Both the main leads are doing such a wonderful job with their body language that you can virtually interpret their thoughts and emotions. It may seem effortless but I am sure this takes an immense amount of skill as well as the ability to trust in one's acting partner to lead as well as be lead into a wonderful mix of the push and pull of relationships. I find myself smiling like a silly fool. It also touches upon a lot of controversial topics like mistreatment/sexual abuse of women at their workplace and in general, romance between an older woman and a younger man, unhealthy/obsessive relationships, mother pressuring their children to only care about the background of people they hang out with and how they can benefit them, negative view on those without parents, on those who pursue an artistic career. Main leads are absolutely adorable together, have amazing chemistry and make you die from happiness while watching them interact.

there are many best kdrama as far as I have watched till now. Instead of best korean drama, I want to share my favorite kdrama in 2015. Here they are : 1. Healer. Starring Ji Chang Wook and Park Min Young, the plot is interesting. I always like this kind of drama because it will make me more curious about next episode. And dont forget Ji Chang Wook is awesome in this drama, like Lee Min Ho in City Hunter :D  2. Pinnochio. This drama starring Lee Jong Suk and Park Shin Hye. This is another kdrama with great story. Lee Jong Suk became a reporter to find out what happens back then in his family who accused wrongly in society because of a reporter, Park Shin Hye mother. It will make you think "is it really happens to media industries in reality?" something like that.  3. Kill Me Heal Me. Ji Sung, Hwang Jung Eum, and Park Seo Joon did a great job in this drama. Ji Sung, has 7 different personalities and meet Hwang Jung Eum who is a doctor and become Ji sung private doctor. This drama make Ji Sung get a Daesang Award from MBC Drama Award 2015. Try to watch it and you'll love it!  4. Ex-girlfriend Club. You know Song Ji Hyo? If you watch running man you sure know her. I love her acting in Goong, Crime Squads, Emergency couple, and now Ex-girlfriend Club. I think she match well with all of her co-star, include Byun Yo Han. The story is unique and also Byun Yo Han's smile is cute, I love his smile.   5. Producer. Great actor and actress are here in this drama! Kim So Hyun, Cha Tae Hyun, Gong Hyo Jin, and IU are all my favorite. At first, I watch this drama because of them but I really like the story of this drama. They are awesome. Kim So Hyun get Daesang Award at KBS Drama Award thanks to Producers.  6. Sassy Go go aka Cheer Up!. Wanna see fresh drama with high school concept? Watch Sassy Go Go. Lee Won Geun (those cute smile :D), Jung Eun Ji, Ji Soo, Chae Soo Bin are all young actor actress with great acting. Although story bit flat but it kind of refreshing to watch this drama thanks to all cast.  7. Yong Pal. Joo Won always make drama he is starring to be number one spot beat other television. And it always great acting of him as a doctor who make an errand to pay his debt. Actually I didnt think Kim Tae will do great in this drama as I watched her performance in Jang Ok Jung, that disappoint me. But dont judge her before you watch this drama, you will completely change your opinion like me. I like her acting as a strong woman not a weak girl. This drama make Joo won also get Daesang at SBS Drama Award.   8. Oh My Ghostess. Jo Jung Suk and Park Bo Young have a great chemistry in this drama, and I just love them. The ghost, Kim Seul Gi, is great too. Im Joo Hwan is in this drama too so I exited to watch. It is rarely to see mix concept between cooking and ghost like in this drama but it become one of my favorite drama in 2015. I just watched this drama in 2 days :D  9. Second Time Twenty Years Old. TvN as a cable television have a great kdrama in 2015. Many drama that produced by it have good response and have good story too. In this drama, Choi Ji Woo, Lee Sang Yoon have good chemistry as a friend and as first love person. I love Lee Sang Yoon and his dimples and of course his acting, Choi Ji Woo always have great acting and I just like her. This drama will tell you many lesson in real life.  10. She Was Pretty. The last of my favorite list is She Was Pretty. After acted as brother-sister in Kill Me Heal Me, Park Seo Joon and Hwang Jung Eum pairing again as a lover in this drama! this is a romantic comedy drama that will make you laughing in each episode. I like all of the cast, the story, and their acting.  Hope you'll like it, and try to watch! :)

I like Korean drama, but only some of them. These are my fav: Kingdom: It is zombies series, set during Korea's Joseon period. The deceased king rises and a mysterious plague begins to spread; the prince must face a new breed of enemies to unveil the evil scheme and save his people.Sky Castle: The story about upper-class parents in Korea. Housewives living at the luxurious residential area called Sky Castle community use every way they can think of to get their children into Seoul National University.My love from the star: Do Min Joon is an alien who was stranded four hundred years ago on Earth. He has cynical views on humans but when he gets entangled in the life of a former actress, his opinion slowly changes.Crash Landing on You: A paragliding mishap drops a South Korean heiress in North Korea - and into the life of an army officer, who decides he will help her hide.A World of Married Couple: Ji Sun-woo is a revered family medicine doctor and the associate director at Family Love Hospital. She is married to Lee Tae-oh, with whom she has a teenage son, Lee Joon-young. Sun-woo seems to have everything from a successful career to a happy family, but unbeknownst to her, she is betrayed by her husband and friends.Dream High: Students at Kirin High School of Artwork hard to achieve their dreams of becoming stars. The story is about friends and dreams.Descendants of the Sun: A love story between Captain Yoo Shi Jin, Korean Special Forces, and Doctor Kang Mo Yeon, a surgeon at Haesung Hospital. Together they face danger in a war-torn country.Enjoy watching!!

I’m going to stir the pot by including some Kdramas that tend to be underrated and overshadowed by some of the more popular titles. The following may seem like an eclectic mix of recommendations, but if you’re looking for quality storytelling and acting, all of these are a must-watch. 1. Ruler of Your Own World (melodrama) -- For those in the mood to be moved and inspired, watch this. An ex-convict seeks redemption after he is released from prison. The story may sound dark and heavy, but it’s packed with enough hope and humor to keep you hooked. It’ll make a person want to shake their fist at the world, Scarlett O’Hara style, and vow to face tomorrow a stronger and better person.http://www.dramafever.com/drama/530/1/Ruler_of_Your_Own_World/ 2. Soulmate (romantic comedy) -- Not the typical Kdrama rom-com. This series elevates the genre into a hilarious and witty commentary on modern relationships. At turns laugh-out-loud, poignant, and insightful. http://www.dramafever.com/drama/20/1/Soulmate/ 3. Sign (crime drama) -- Even if crime dramas are not your thing, give Sign a chance. It offers a rare and honest glimpse into the corrupt reality of South Korea’s political institutions, and it features a stellar cast. Best of all, Sign provides unexpected moments of romance and comedy that really balances out the suspense.http://www.dramafever.com/drama/3904/1/Sign/ 4. Sandglass (melodrama) -- Although Sandglass is considered to be the godmother of all Kdramas, it is not your prototypical, easily-digestible Kdrama in that it offers a glimpse into a very painful moment in South Korea's modern history. Still, its brilliant casting and storytelling made it an instant classic -- over 50% of Korea tuned into watch the series finale. It's an epic with great historical resonance. http://www.dramafever.com/drama/115/1/Sandglass/ There are plenty more quality Korean dramas that shatter the misconception that Kdramas are shallow, emotionally heavy-handed vehicles for pretty actors and actresses. See for yourself at DramaFever, a free video streaming website that offers Korean dramas for free (www.dramafever.com).

Well, I really can’t answer with just one. I’ll give you a choice: Signal. OMG. The out and out best time tweaker (not really time travel) that I’ve EVER seen, including various great Star Trek episodes (I am a Trekkie) & a couple intense Doctor Who ones (Whovian as well). Consequences of changing the past - so well done! Nothing grandiose, world-shattering - just real cases (the Hwaseong serial murders in SK) that has never been solved, coupled with the Miryang gang rape case - or a facsimile thereof) with a lot of ‘what if’s that made complete sense. The premise is similar to the film Frequency (ie a young policeman in the present picks up an old walkie-talkie & finds himself in communication w/a detective from the 1980s) - but the plot! You think, oh the two saved someone - then find out the consequences to the future - it’s like a maze. Ursula LeGuin’s Lathe of Heaven comes to mind. Misaeng. The Office married to Dilbert, with an endearing cast of young interns, and done quite realistically. Funny, heartbreaking, maddening and scathing. Anyone who’s worked in a cubicle factory like this recognized the culture immediately. Adapted from a manhwa which is equally awesome. Mother. Just ended. Nominated for a Cannes Award (the entry for SK - 9 other international entries). Adapted from an excellent Jdrama of the same name. Lee Bo Young deserves every award available for her performance here. Lee Hye Young - amazing - I cried buckets. The child actress - Heo Yool - loved that child. The story overtly addresses child abuse, but also what it means to be a mother to a child. Just Between Lovers. A drama that walked a fine line between makjang & romance, managing to transcend both. There’s a love story here, between two damaged souls who’ve survived a horrific mass accident (mall collapse), but how that accident affected everyone involved even peripherally weaves through the story, demanding attention. Healer. Just drama crack. Perfect performances, compelling storyline, and the BEST, most angst-free loveline I’ve ever seen in a KDrama (out of the 300+ I’ve watched). Ji Chang Wook OMG This is the one drama I’ve watched multiple times. Ahjumma rules! EDIT & UPDATE: My Mister. A great character study, and interesting look at the life of an architect with a complicated family life and a close circle of friends. He’s seen thru the eyes of a young girl, who struggles to take care of her ailing grandmother by taking any jobs she can - she’s a temp at the architectural firm & is hired by someone at the company to find dirt on our lead guy. She taps his phone & can hear all his interactions with everyone - which gives her an insight into his character. GREAT drama. Dear My Friends. Just a charming, moving, realistic look at a group of friends who’ve known each other since grade school and are now moving into old age. Lovely drama.
