Yes I definitely do . So it comes as no surprise that I have watched too many of them to count, making it all the more difficult to choose my favourite. It is like a kid in a candy store kind of situation . I just love all of them . I believe kdrama in recent times have become so popular because of the fact that it caters to a wide range of audiences with its various genres. So I'll try listing out the ones that I believe has the right mix of everything. 1st : GOBLIN  No other drama has come close to making feel things like this one did . Although I was apprehensive initially as it was supposed to be having shades of fantasy weaved in to it I still went ahead to watch it as I curious to watch the older Gong Yoo in a drama after having watched him in another favorite of mine - Coffee Prince. There is only one word to describe the drama right from the very 1st episode until the very last - magical !! There is enough humor to make you laugh your heart out that you forget for a moment that it has a gut wrenching story line as well. You laugh one moment, you cry one moment and then you start rooting for the characters as they grow on you . Not many villains to hate , but plenty of characters to love and to cheer on. With a beautiful and scenic screenplay, your eyes will thank you for the feast and your heart for the bliss !!! 2. SUSPICIOUS PARTNER   Another rib tickling drama loaded with Scense and sensibility ! Beautiful people on screen , an engaging storyline with a villain who scares the crap out of you along with scenes so relatable that it almost looks like it was ripped off from your life !! Do watch it if you need one hell of ride of complete entertainment!!!

All foreign things are attractive, no matter what, I guess it goes with series as well. I was suggested to watch k-drama by my cousin and she even showed me one episode of her favourite series. If you have not watched single series and planing to watch one, I must suggest you that those are more powerful than drugs and will not allow to live peacefully until you finish whole series. It's the first series I watched and it's my all time favorite .Its best suited series for teenagers and it's the best series to kick start .Its a story of 4 rich boys and a stupid girl. My god, those boys are really breath taking. (you might get huge crush on any one of those 4 boys) .I can just give one line story that it's all about love triangles with few other extra story added to it. It has a great story line ,but at some point you might get bored, I suggest you to forward those) . Overall ,it's really cool drama and deserves number 1 position. 2.My love from another star. It's just Perfect but at certain point it's boring. 6) 49 days It's a beautiful story and 49 days is not just random number, it has a deep story connected. It's has story filled mystery, suspense, romance, souls and scheduler .series is filled with emotions and makes you get connected to it as well. It's about girl who mets with an accident and turns into soul. And story continues from their. I don't want to reveal anything cause it worth watching. 6) Goblin It's an romantic story with lots of things added to it. Currently, I have 3 dramas and in no particular order. Healer This drama is one of those rare dramas that is not disliked by many people because everything about this drama is absolutely lovable. Amazing leads, superb acting and laudable story- this drama has everything. Oh, and Ji Chang-wook is a delight to watch as he plays this role with all his efforts, making him the star in this drama. Every character has a story and every story is interconnected. It’s a win-win in its genre.  Secret Garden I absolutely love this drama. And there are just 100 reasons for me to love it. The first and foremost reason has to be Hyun Bin- he, his role, his acting, his looks, his voice and his dimples- the way he plays both the arrogant CEO Kim Joo-won and the stuntwoman Gil Ra-im (after the souls are interchanged) is a delight. But, Ha Ji-won is no less. She was an amazing counterpart and the way she plays the role of Gil Ra-im with such prowess was amazing. Supporting actors too were really strong-headed There’s everything in this drama- comedy, fantasy, emotions, some really good scenes and amazing OST.  My Love From Another Star Save the best for the last! There’s absolutely no doubt that the way this story is written is much more interesting than many other movies or serials (American and British shows included). It’s an alien-Hallyu actress love story, set between the past and present, with the alien Do Min-joon falling in love with the adult version of the lookalike of his first love of 17th century! He uses his powers of teleporting and stopping time in some of the most interesting ways. Again, all the characters are interwoven among each other. This short description itself sounds so interesting that no one could skip this drama. Jun Ji-hyun is the most amazing actress in my dictionary after watching her in this drama. She is simply the best.

Yes. I do love korean dramas. And I watch and review them on my blog. I have watched around 40 korean dramas by now and 1 chinese drama out of which the supernatural kdrama happens to be my favorite genre. For my top favorote kdramas, I suggest, Pinnochio . It's a story about a girl who has Pinnochio syndrome. This syndrome makes the person hiccup whenever they lie making it impossible to lie. She (Park Shin Hye) and the male lead played by Lee Jong Suk decide to become reporters. He, especially is determined to find out the truth of the fire accident that caused his father, the leader of the firefighting squad to have his name ruined as he led his team members to their death. It's one amazing drama.All in. It's the story of Kim In Ha , a man whoSe uncle taught him how to gamble. He and his best friend are jailed for a crime they accidently committed, but his friends Roch father using his influence helps him escape leaving In Ha in jail. Seven years later he is out and he meets his friend and his lost love, Min Soo Yeon in the background of a casino. Eventually many interesting events take place leading In Ha deeper into the world of casino and gambling where sometimes he uses his own life as a bet.Kill me heal me. It's a story of a man who has multiple personality disorder. Within him, there are 7 personalities that keep coming out in him at odd times. He then arranges a rrsudeny doctor to take care of him but they both find that they have connectons spanning through many years. The theme of the series is based on violence towards children as well.There are so many more that are amazing. But these would be my top three.

I wouldn't recommend typical popular k dramas like Boys Over Flowers, The Heirs, Winter Sonata, etc. K dramas keep improving year after year. 1. Beautiful Gong Shim - the wittiest drama I've ever seen. Minah portrays a cute, clumsy artist wannabe who rents out her house in hopes of saving enough money to study in Italy, and she meets no other than An Dan Tae, a lawyer for the poor. The drama is full of funny moments, with a touch of mystery that makes it more than just a shallow rom-com. 2. The King of Drama - centred in the South Korean film industry, it tells of a formerly ruthless PD and a scriptwriter who come together to revive his career. His ex-girlfriend and now a huge star also happens to be playing the first female lead in the drama within a drama. Plenty of oppourtunity for kisses, nostalgia, and scheming. 3. Please Come Back Ahjussi - Rain Bi stars in this slightly melodramatic drama on two guys who get a chance to come back to life in new bodies and fix their regrets. A touching drama that will invoke tears, laughter, and surprise. 4. Doctors - currently airing! Park Shin Hye makes a great gangster-turned-doctor who is trying to solve the death of her grandmother, who died during surgery. She meets her teacher again, who this time is vying for her love. Hard to explain but really good!Written Jul 25 · Taken from my answer to a similar question. I've also written answers for good makjang drama recommendations and the best Korean movies.

I started watching K-dramas in 2015 and haven’t had a day with out them since. Seriously, even when I travel, I find a way to stream a K-drama or two. Depending on your taste, you should do a bit of research to start with. I started with a historical and loved the East/West mythology mashup, the clothing, and intro into Korean heaven. Moon Embracing the Sun had lavish costumes and a touch of fantasy along with great actors. It hooked me. Then I went with a tried and true contemporary, Secret Garden. All dramas are character based, have an overall theme, and contain some type of romance with arias similar to an opera. I’ve watched so many at this point I can’t remember all of them. However, a few do come to mind. For RomComs: I’d go with Again, Oh Hae Young. It has an amazing cast and a touch of fantasy. Oh My Venus hooked my husband and he watched several K-dramas with me, afterwards. For contemporary Drama/Fantasy, I’d definitely watch Goblin, Great and Lonely God. Fabulous cast, great interaction between male leads and a terrific ending. For real Drama, I’d pick up Call Me Mother, but be warned, it will pluck your emotions down to the core. My Mister is another drama and it deals with several contemporary Korean issues from finances to the changing face of family. Also, SkyCastle, an international hit, deals with educational competition and the lengths families will go to obtain admission to high-end universities. There are also drama sites on the Internet where fans discuss favorites. Check them out. K-dramas should come with a warning label: Highly Addictive. Enjoy

I'm going to list a few which I've actually watched. 1. Orange marmalade:  Set in a fantasy world where humans and vampires coexist, the latter have evolved and no longer rely on human blood as food. Still, they are feared and discriminated by society, causing many of them to hide their true nature and live as "normal" citizens, or else become outcasts. [Okay, don't say it's cliche. This stuff is really different than twilight and Evernight{Book Series by Claudia Grey (female vampire)}, you should watch it once.] 2. I'm sorry, I love you:  Cha Moo-hyuk is a small-time scam artist working the streets of Australia. He was abandoned by his parents as a child and he was adopted by a couple in Australia.[2] Unfortunately, he was mistreated by his foster parents and thus roams the streets, cheating tourists out of their money when they are lost. It is through one of these scams that he bumps into Song Eun-chae. 3. Autumn in my heart:  The story begins with toddler, Yoon Joon-suh accidentally causing the switch of his sister and another baby when he drops the name cards on the two babies' cribs in the hospital's baby room. A nurse who comes in puts the name cards back incorrectly. 4. Emperor of the sea:  Jang Bogo (Choi Soo-jong) rises from a lowly slave to the military commander of the sea during the Unified Silla Dynasty. Along the way, he battles pirates, and engages in a heated rivalry with Madam Jami (Chae Shi-ra), a Silla noble who squares off against Jang Bogo for trade rights in the South Sea. Yeom Jang (Song Il-gook), Jang Bogo's charismatic comrade, supports Jang in his ascension to become the "Emperor of the Sea." But Yeom Jang competes with Jang Bogo for the love of Lady Jung-hwa (Soo Ae). 5. Sassy Girl (or Delightful Girl):  Chun-hyang is smart and sassy and becomes involved with good looking Mong-ryong. His first love Chae-rin enters the picture. An older man, Hak-do, pursues her. Will they find their way back to each other? And many more. These are the ones I've watched myself. Good ones thought

The best Korean drama I've ever come across was a series called Iris.  I came across it a while after I came across its add on series ATHENA--something I stumbled upon by accident because I was looking up Choi Si Won from the new Taiwanese drama of the popular manga series Skip Beat.   The thing about Iris was that it was so well made that 99% of the time, you forgot it was a drama.  The show plays a lot like American shows like Nikita or 24.  It has long drawn out setups and lots of talking, coupled with extreme and sometimes bone chilling action.  Unlike American shows where we ignore the effects of say... what a car blowing up right next to you would do to you, this show doesn't.  The fighting is incredibly good and the story is too.  The budget for this drama was over 20 billion won ($17mil U.S.).  They brought in people from other nations to speak their native languages, and traveled to other countries to shoot.  They also made an add on drama to the series called: Athena: Goddess of War.     Another bonus is that the cast in both shows are not only all excellent actors, but they have the looks too.  You won't be sitting there wishing you were watching Boys Over Flowers instead...  And for anyone who's into the romance aspect of dramas, this show won't leave you out in the cold.  It has plenty of romantic drama mixed in to keep you happy.  For anyone who enjoys action thrillers and Korean dramas, these two are a must see.

Dramabeans.com is a great resource for recaps (http://www.dramabeans.com/category/k-drama), reviews (http://www.dramabeans.com/category/drama-reviews), and ratings (http://www.dramabeans.com/about/ratings) of a ton of dramas. I would recommend checking out the ratings section for a quick overview of the good, the bad, and the meh. As for my personal favorites, aside from the ones already mentioned, I would also add: My Name is Kim Sam SoonClassic k-drama and what started it all for me. Hilarious comedy with great (and now well-known) cast members. Sometimes referred to as the Korean "Bridget Jones Diary". On-Air (2008)Another classic in my opinion, and one of my favorite OST's. Explores the private and professional lives of those in TV drama production. Good writing with lots of meta, romantic, and comedic moments throughout. Another great (and well-known) cast. City HunterOne of the best dramas this year. An action thriller with a quest for revenge/justice (think Monte Cristo) as the driving plot point. Love the two leads and their chemistry - they're a couple in real life now! Was pretty happy with the writing throughout the run of the series. Dream HighFilled with k-pop stars so not the greatest acting in the world but sincere efforts all around. Has singing, dancing, and decent character growth. Another favorite OST of mine. Park Jin Young (CEO of JYP Entertainment) is surprisingly and wonderfully entertaining in his role. The Man Who Can't Get MarriedA fun comedy with a quirky but eventually loveable male lead. Secondary characters and storylines are pretty enjoyable as well.

These are my favorite: Descendants of the SunGenre: Drama, Romance A soldier’s and a doctor’s second chance at love (in Uruk). This is a must. It has a right to be so famous. I loved the idea of what it meant to be a “descendant of the sun” (although it’s not clearly stated in the drama). The love between a man who lives to kill and a woman who lives to save people and their chemistry makes this drama my favorite. Age of YouthGenre: Slice of Life, Suspense, Comedy Five college girls live in a dorm. They all have different life situations and personalities. This drama had bad ratings but some of the best reviews I had ever seen, so I watched it. I will never regret that decision. Every girl from the dorm is unique and relatable from the introverted to the girl that can see ghosts. A really great drama if you like slice of life. Weightlifting Fairy Kim Bok JooGenre: Slice of Life, Romance, Comedy Kim Bok Joo is a weightlifter that experiences love for the first time. This will bring a lot of problems and new experiences that will change her life. Another hidden gem. This cute college couple will change your life. It takes subjects such as insecurities, traumas, abandonment, goals and career struggles and completely shakes you. Goblin, the Lonely and Great GodGenre: Supernatural, Comedy, Romance A goblin lives for 900 years looking for a wife. He finally founds her, a high schooler that was supposed to die at the womb, but he starts to question if he wants to die. After a turn of events, he ends up living with a grim reaper. Although there were some points were I was just annoyed (there’s a limit to my pity) by the girl, it is amazing. The Grim Reaper and Goblin relationship is the best thing to ever happen in Korean dramas. The plot twists and the funny moments will hook you up until the end. My Love From Another StarGenre: Supernatural, Romance An alien has three months left in Earth when he finds himself mixed up with an actress and a psychopath killer. A classic. Frankly, I liked her more in this drama than in The Legend of the Blue Sea. It’s a perfect mix of comedy, supernatural and suspense. ……………………………………………… Other dramas worth mentioning: Coffee Prince (gender bender must)Pinocchio (mainly because it’s one of the main reasons I chose to major in Journalism)You’re All Surrounded(the best police drama out there)Let’s Fight Ghost (cutest dynamic duo ever)City Hunter (my first kdrama)To Be Continued (Just. Astro.)Hwarang (beauty everywhere. ZEA, BTS, SHINee fans beware.)

I got addicted to k dramas last year and till now I watch them everyday. There are already many which I have seen. But the best which i have seen many times already and are very popular are: My love from another star- It stars Kim Soo Hyun and Jun Ji Hyun. The leads are perfect in looks and their chemistry is also perfect. If you want a drama with Fantasy, Romance, a bit of comedy, good cast and interesting story, then this is for you.Personal taste- It stars Lee Min Ho and Son Ye-jin. It is not that popular. But I would recommend it if you need a drama which has comedy, romance and which does not go overboard. It will not let you down. And it's small i.e only 16 EPs. I love it. It's my fav. So give it a try first. It's the best here in this list according to me.Legend of the blue sea- It stars LMH and Jun Ji Hyun. It is a must watch. It has everything like a bit of past and present fusion, comedy, romance and the concept is also totally new. The main female lead is also a mermaid here. Once you start you will love it and not regret it for sure.City hunter- Again it's a LMH drama. It stars LMH and Park Min Young. It's action packed. At first I thought action thing is not for me and seeing the synopsis I was disappointed. But the drama is totally different. Give it a try if you like LMH. It's a must if you are just new to k dramas. Try it now.Noble my love- It stars Sung Hoon and Kim Jae Kyung. Although it's not my fav, still I recommend it bcoz it was my first K-drama. And it's the reason I kept looking for more and more dramas later on. It is short so I feel you will like it even more.Playful kiss- It stars Kim Hyun Joong and Jung So Min. It is a story in high school set up. If you are tired of watching the dramas where a rich guy falls for a poor girl, this one's for you. Here the main female lead is in love with the main male lead from the beginning. It might not look good, but look for the synopsis and trailer and I am sure you would love it. And also the female lead is so cute her acting will force you to stick to the drama till the very end.Boys over flowers- It stars Lee Min Ho and Ku Hye Sun. It's a drama of 2009 but still is among the very bests even now. I did not want to watch it bcoz it's pretty long 25 EPs. But if you want a high school theme and handsome and rich guys, a beautiful female lead and the main male lead to be arrogant types then this is for you. You might have heard about it already, it's so popular.Sassy go go or Cheer up- It stars Lee Won Kuen and Jung Eun Ji.It's a mini drama i.e 12 eps series, so I saw it. The chemistry b/w the male and female lead is perfect. Although the female lead is not that pretty according to me, the male lead,his smile will keep you sticking to the drama till the very end.You are beautiful- It stars Jang Keun -Suk and Park Shin Hye. It's all music. The male lead, his facial expressions kept me go through the drama till the very end. There are two others male lead who collaborate very well with the story. Park Shin Hye is all cute and innocent having a double role here which does not show much till the end.These are the ones I have already seen and I have tried to arrange them in the order I like. These are must watch if you are new to k-dramas. Even if you are not, try these they will not disappoint you. Faith.Fated to love you.Heirs.Innocent guy or nice man.Full house.First shop of coffee prince.Goong or princess hours.My princess.Oh my lady.These are also good. I have seen all of them. I have seen many others but these are the best by far now. Descendants of the sun.My girlfriend is a gumiho.Sungkyunkwan Scandal.Moon embracing the sun.Dream high and Dream high 2.Pinocchio.These are the ones of which i have already read the synopsis and loved it. I will be watching them soon. So you too give it a try. They are among the most populars right now. DOTS (first one) is among the recents, I have seen some eps. Watch it if you have not yet started.

I've watched a lot of K-dramas over the years. These are just some of my favorite ones (in no particular order) Romance is a Bonus Book  A gifted writer who's the youngest editor-in-chief ever at his publishing company becomes enmeshed in the life of a former copywriter desperate for a job. (2019) W  A surgical resident is pulled into the webtoon world of W, which was created by her father, and becomes entangled in a murder mystery. (2016) Memories of the Alhambra  While searching for the cryptic creator of an innovative augmented reality game, an investment firm executive meets a woman who runs a hostel in Spain. (2019) Guardian: The Lonely and Great God (Goblin)  The immortal goblin has spent his whole immortal life waiting for his bride to appear so that she can break his 900 year long curse. (2016 - 2017) The Bride of Haebaek  A narcissistic god seeking his rightful throne comes to Earth to search for a powerful stone and enlists the help of a psychiatrist destined to become his wife despite her skepticism of his divine origins. (2017) Weightlifting Fairy Kim Bok Joo  A coming-of-age story about a group of college athletes who are fighting for their dreams, experiencing and finding love in the process (2016-2017) I'm Not a Robot  A woman becomes entangled in a strange love triangle after pretending to be a robot that looks exactly like her. (2017-2018) Voice  Black  A grim reaper gets punished for breaking the rules of heaven and falling in love with a mortal woman after inhabiting a human body. My absolute favorite drama is “My love from Another Star”. The story is unique And the cast is outstanding. The main leads make the drama perfect. They are amazing actors and the chemistry was so beautiful to watch. Infact, all the characters were casted perfectly. I enjoyed the transition and intermingling of past and present. The book shown in the drama was so well presented that I did end up reading the book. Plus, the factual or analyzing anecdotes made the drama more enjoyable for me. I love smart, witty and humorous dramas and this certainly fit the criteria for me. I highly reccomend it to everyone. It is a drama so well executed that I constantly watch it over and over again. The second drama that I enjoyed immensely is “Oh my Venus”. I have to admit that I wanted to watchthe drama because of the main actor. He is so Hot! However, its the story that captivated me. It was the first drama that I watched while it was on air so I anxiously waited every week for its english subtitled uploads. Each character left an impact for me. Heck, it motivated me to work out and take better care of myself. The plot line are weaved into the main story so wonderfully. Its an emotional, beautiful, and funny drama - a must watch for all Korean dramas lovers. Though, I love and watch many K-dramas, these two made a lasting impact for me.

When I’d first started getting into K-dramas, it was the end of high school and early college. I was really into all the school dramas from both Japan and Korea bc I thought it was so cool to see comraderie in their classes and schools, such an opposite in western schools, compared to my own experiences, which I hated. School dramas were like an ideal school life for me lol. But now that I'm older, I find myself more into serious, real life topics like serious relationships, family, work, and slice of life. I like shows not just for the hype, but generally, long-time drama fans can pick up on good quality. So I actually do watch for well-produced shows with good acting and well-paced stories. My list in no particular order: My Love From Another StarThe Girl Who Could See SmellsGoblinAge of YouthDiscovery of Love/ RomanceOh My GhostessPinocchio

I never watch Korean dramas, but I do watch some shows occasionally. I’ve already answered to a very similar question, so I will post a portion of it here. Original link: Jangwon Suh's answer to What are some of the best Korean variety shows? This is the best variety show in Korea in my opinion: 비정상회담 (Non-Summit) - A talk-variety show where people from countries around the globe who can talk in Korean discuss about various subjects and ideas. It was a very fresh new concept to the Korean variety show business. I really like the show. Key Members: Yoo Se-yoon, Jeon Hyun-moo, Seong Shi-gyung, and many non-Korean panels Some other notable best shows are: 속사정 쌀롱 - A human psychology debate show where they talk about human’s various psychological behaviors by giving real life experiments. A Korean legend of the Metal music genre, Shin Hae-cheol, appeared at the first episode of 속사정 쌀롱 and soon passed away due to medical malpractice. Sad. 썰전 - A politics debate show, but it tries to speak for both right-wings and left-wings and keep the debate entertaining and light to approach to the general public. 말하는 대로 - A reality talk show where guests go out to the streets, gather up citizens and talk about their lives. 어쩌다 어른 - A lecture-and-debate show where people with expertise stand in front of a small audience, give out lectures, and have debates. It’s similar to TED, but is longer, and interacts with the audience. Really fun. Unfortunately, all four of these shows do not seem to be introduced to non-Korean viewers. They don’t even have a proper English name for it. If your Korean is good enough, you should definitely try watching these.

Here are some good KDrama list . Hope you all enjoy while watching these. They are in my preference order with some brief information. Jealousy incarnate  The theme itself is so much exciting , that you would love to watch the scenes again and again to just get the feel again. These are my top 5 till now , hope to see much more good KDRAMA in the future. My favorite one - My love from other star

I got into watching them because of a friend-cum-spiritual mentor of mine who lived and watched them in Singapore. Based on her recommendations I watched a few of them. Loved almost all of them Love from a Star - Is my most favorite. I’ve watched this twice. Love the way reincarnation, history, social evolution of humanity, human darkness and an alien are all weaved together. These are individually heavy concepts but the way the writer(s) have weaved them effortlessly and kept the characters very fragile, very human is astounding. It is simply high quality writing. And I love the portrayal by the actors. Both of them are so “natural” and in the skin of their characters…I cannot imagine how creatively rewarding this entire series must be for all of them.Good Doctor - This series blew my mind on how a special needs person who is a genius at medicine yet lacks basic social skills even struggles to get accepted and qualified as a doctor. The first episode itself is so riveting and intense that it hooks you straight on. Again the characters are so well etched out. Bringing out the aspect of the man who opposes the main character and how his opposition actually is a blessing is the way life itself works and I was humbled by how it is brought about so subtly and cleanly.Ex-Girlfriends Club - Though story-wise there isn’t too much happening, but what I liked is that the main character of a man with many ex-girlfriends who are not ready to leave him, is shown very well. There is a human side to a man who tries to be a “rescuer” to these women who seek their identity through him and not ready to let him go.So far so good :)

You're all surrounded - it focuses on a group of new detectives who obviously solves crimes. There's a major mack story, which focuses on Eun Dae Gu (I think that's his name), and his traumatic past. It's super goodI can hear your voice - again it's a crime one, but it's more about lawyers than detectives. There's a character played my Lee Jong Suk, and he can read people's thoughts. He helps the lawyers win their cases and at the same time, put the man who murdered his dad, back into prisonMoorim school - this one is about 2 young boys who go to this elite martial arts school. Hongbin from the kpop group Vixx, plays an heir to a chinese business and becomes friends with a kpop idol who has chi power (he basically has cool powers)Blood - blood is about a top surgeon who is also secretly a vampire. He finds out more about himself, and how to control his thirst for blood. At the same time, there's this sort of war between good vampires and bad vampires. The show features a roller-coaster of emotions so prepare yourselfThe great doctor - this one a little repetitive but it's enjoyable nonetheless. It's set in the Goryeo dynasty, and is about a female doctor from present time, who gets dragged into the dynasty to save a dying queen. There she meets a famous, strong general (played by Lee Min Ho) and falls in love. Time is tough for her however, as the people believe that she is a doctor sent from “heaven”. Many people try to take her but she just wants to go back to present timeThese are my top 5. Please watch. They're fabulous

I can't believe no one has mentioned Playful/Mischevious kiss!   It's not the best, I agree. It's sweet and very relaxing. If you're a regular girl/gay guy, I guarantee you'll love it(Did I lose the straight guy demographic there?). I always say, watch the pilot and a couple more episodes; it's a very small investment. Give playful kiss a try. It's very popular, yes, unrealistic, but if you want hard-hitting facts you might as well watch a documentary.  The story goes like this. A handsome guy with high IQ is loved by a girl with moderate looks and grades. She's innocent (mostly stupid, but so adorably stupid, I see why one wouldn't want to watch that, I don't judge people who watch reality tv, besides, this is much better, I swear). The show focuses on how her love blossoms and how things go for her. I don't want to give too much away.  After reading this answer, if you went on Viki.com and watched atleast two episodes of Playful kiss you would've really added a few smiles to your life. Just try it, okay? If high school romances are a no-no for you, I suggest watching My love from the star.   It's about a human-looking alien who lives on earth for 400 years waiting for his next trip back home and 3 months before his departure falls in love with a human woman. There's alot of story here. Not alot of over the top melodrama. You'll thank me :)

Look at your description and not being a fan of popular high school dramas like Boys over Flowers, Dream High and School 2013, also suggests that your interests lean more towards that genre and you prefer high-shool, campus sort of rom-coms over action and thrillers. As some of the previous answers have already mentioned, my best pick for you would be Weightlifting Fairy Kim Bok Joo. It is a fun rom-com in a campus setting with only 16 episodes. There are no rich guy-poor girl romancing, but more of a real life feel. The chemistry between the two leads are so real, that the couple is dating in real life as well.  My next pick for you is Moonlights Drawn Clouds. It has a historical setting, but not the typical rigid, boring sageuk drama. This also a fun rom-com with an adorable young couple. It also has cross dressing which makes it more interesting. With 18 episodes.  Sungkyunkwan Scandal is another similar drama where the main female lead cross dresses. The setting is in the historical Sungkyunkwan Educational Institutes for boys that belong to the elite. This is also an interesting historical romantic comedy. Worth the watch for 20 episodes. In this pandemic, this is a new engagement which I found for myself. I am a die hard Srk lover. If at all anything is close to the romantic scenes of K2H2, DDLJ, Veer Zaara, it is a Korean love series. It takes you back to that era of good movies( though illogical;)). Below are my few favourites and they have been ranked in the same order. Oh my Venus — One of the cutest series I have watched in the recent times. Smooth effortless acting of the stars. Not a great but an engaging plotline. If you haven't watched any Korean series till date, pls start with this.Crash Landing on You — Excellent plot series which engages you till the very end. Super handsome and beautiful characters. You will get to know the two sides of Korea — South and North.Something in the Rain — A very mature series. Korean culture when it comes to marriage is very similar to Indian culture. You will go through a lot of ups and downs during the series and can compare the harassment one has to go through a conservative set up when it comes to involvement of parents in their child's life even after they being independent and in their thirties.Doctor Stranger — A very different and confusing yet very engaging and thriller series. Super handsome actor. None of this is possible in the real world yet you will be glued to this one till the very end.One Spring Night — Again a very mature series. Though it becomes slow at times but then I loved the way the writer has done characterisation of the main lead actress. She has been shown mentally very strong and I loved the way she handles her hurdles without losing her calm.I have watched many many more series but penned down the top 5 for me till now. Any more recommendations required, do let me know:) Would be happy to help

Read all the answers and noticed no one written much about the famous Korean drama “ LEGEND OF THE BLUE SEA “ It is by far the best Korean drama I have ever seen. The story revolves around a young man who is a very skilled Con artist named Heo Joon-jae played by most loved and handsome Lee Min-ho. Joon-Jae travels to Spain for a vacation where he met a girl who he first thought is insane and can’t speak but later finds she is just hungry and needs some help. He felt very bad about her and helps her. They spend one day together and Joon-Jae started liking the company of her. They end up falling in love with each other. But it's their fate that want something else. Soon the goons arrive to kill Joon-Jae. They ran to the end of the cliff where in order to save themselves they had to jump off the cliff. It was then revealed to Joon-Jae that the girl is a mermaid. She kisses him so to erase his memories of her. Joon Jae flies back to Seoul with no memories of her. But the love for the women persist. Will they meet again. See for yourself. It's a Beautiful Story of Twist & turn and Fate. Do Watch It.  Up vote if you like this drama!

Thanks for the answer request User-11309324426999237415. I will try to recommend some dramas that have not being mentioned mostly in other answers, but totally worth to watch. Pinocchio (2015) starring Lee Jong Suk and Park Shin Hye. This is a romantic comedy that has a journalism polt which makes it interesting. Plus the bond between the main couple is excellent which makes them one of the best loved pairs. 2. If you prefer medical dramas such as Doctor Crush, I suggest you to watch Yong-Pal (2015) starring Joo Won and Kim Tae Hee. You will find a rich girl-poor guy drama with sort of thriller aspect as the romance develops.  3. My all-time favourite has to be Goblin - The Lonely And Great God. It is head and shoulders above any other drama I've had the chance to follow under many an aspect: Photography-wiseSoundtrack-wiseDialogue-wiseEmotion-wiseActing-wise (just go through the names casted and it will be no surprise once you start watching) As per creativity and original plot, I do believe both this and W - Two Worlds are to be mentioned first and there is an on-going battle for the title, as both are genius with no bloomers (or bloopers, depending on your area) nor inaccuracies. The actress for the female lead (Han Hyo-Joo) and the actor playing her father (Kim Eui-Sung) are simply top-notch.  Cinematographically speaking, Beautiful World is work-of-art impressive, and both the acting and the way the plot develops are impeccable. For reference, this is my personal second to favourite right after the first I've mentioned, as genius and mind-blowing as the afore-mentioned W may be. Cho Yeo-Jeong (in the picture below) is in this as one of the most important characters, so you probably know what level of good acting to expect.

Thank you for the request Aditi! I agree with Athena’s list. Misaeng and Romantic Teacher are really good dramas. Here are my suggestions for dramas light on the romance: White Christmas (2011)  An 8-episode, thriller/suspense drama which asks the question: Are monsters born or made? There’s mystery, murder and an introspection on motives and what makes people do what they do. Signal (2016)  A detective enlists the help of a profiler from the future in order to solve prevent crimes. One of the highest rating cable shows ever, this one’s very well paced, intelligently written and interestingly shot. Jealousy Incarnate (2016)  Now, I know you said no romanc-ey kdramas, but hear me out. This one’s not your ordinary romcom. While the premise is a look into how jealousy turns into love, this 24-episode drama tackles other issues such as cancer, friendship and office politics in a quirky, fun and thoughtful fashion. With the writing great and the direction chockful of symbolisms, this one’s a must watch. Enjoy!

There are many favourite dramas that I have in my list . Out of that huge list , I will pick Hwarang - The poetic warriors. The Casts are Park Seo-joon , Go-Ara, Park Hyung Sik, Choi min ho. ( Not mentioning all the casts ) It is a periodic drama set in the Kingdom of Silla. The story is about a group of elite, handsome and charming men who joins together to form a community called “Hwarang”. The main focus of this elite group is to develop unity and respect for each other and to fight against the 'bone rank system'. The bone rank system was considered to be the reason why common men in the country couldn't live a peaceful life. And Hwarang is said to be considered as the future of Silla. Another beautiful part is the bromance between park Seo-joon and Park Hyung Sik. Another cute bromance is seen between Choi min ho - do ji han. It is a beautiful story and the drama is a visual treat too.

Goblin Guardian: The Lonely and Great God STORY In ancient times, Kim Shin (Gong Yoo) is an unbeatable general in wars, but the young King (Kim Min-Jae) is jealous of Kim Shin and kills him. Kim Shin becomes Dokkaebi (Goblin), possessing an immortal life. At first he thinks that he is blessed, but he realizes that he is cursed. Closer to the present day, Kim Shin has waited 900 years for a human bride to end his immortal life. One night, he saves a dying pregnant woman (Park Hee-Von) who is destined to die. Meanwhile, the Grim Reaper (Lee Dong-Wook) is unable to find the dead pregnant woman. The woman gives birth to a baby girl named Ji Eun-Tak (later played by Kim Go-Eun). 9 years later, Ji Eun-Tak lives with her mother and is able to see ghosts. One night, her mother suddenly dies. On that night, she meets the Grim Reaper. In the present day, Ji Eun-Tak is a high school student. She still sees ghosts and hears their whisper of “Dokkaebi’s bride.” She now lives with her aunt’s family, but she is mistreated by them. On her birthday, Ji Eun-Tak sits by the sea with a lighted birthday cake. At that time, Kim Shin suddenly appears in front of her. Kim Shin does not know why, but he can hear her voice and appears in front of her against his will. Coincidentally, Kim Shin lives with the Grim Reaper at the same house. Now, Kim Shin appears in front of her against his will, whenever she turns off the lights. One day, Ji Eun-Tak tells him that he is Dokkaebi and she is his bride.

I'll tell you my top 5 kdramas without giving any spoilers:- 1. Strong Woman Do Bong Soon  The only thing I can say is, if you haven't watched this, trust me you are missing the best show of your life. 2. School2015  I loved the storyline of this drama. Also Kim So Hyun's acting in it is exceptionally good. 3. Noble, My Love  It's a web series. I must say, it's the best web series I've seen so far. 4. The K2  This show is related to politics to a great extent. But damn! Ji Chang Wook, in a black suit, as a bodyguard defines ‘perfection’. 5 Bride Of The Century  According to me, this show quite underrated. I never heard about this show and was quite amazed after finishing it. I always prefer shows where the leads look forward to marriage rather than just dating. So all more reasons to find it appealing. Edit: One must really watch Weight Lifting Fairy Kim Bok Joo. It’s of the best drama I've seen so far. Tbh I never planned to watch this show cause well I thought it might not reach my expectations but boy was I wrong? It was far beyond my expectations.

1- DESCENDANTS OF THE SUN— the story of Captain Yoo-Si Jin, a Special Forces Officer, who instantly falls in love with a doctor during a crisis situation. Starring Song Joong-ki Song Hye-kyo Jin Goo Kim Ji-won   2- BOYS OVER FLOWERS— The story of Geum Jan-Di, a normal girl who finds herself attending a prestigious private school after saving a student's life. Starring Lee Min-ho, Ku Hye-sun, Kim Hyun-joong (of SS501), Kim Bum, Kim Joon (of T-Max) and Kim So-eun. 3- THE HEIRS— Cha Eun Sang and her disabled mother take up humiliating jobs such as washing dishes to support her older sister's studies in America. She is fed up of her dull life in Korea. Starring Lee Min-ho, Park Shin-hye and Kim Woo-bin.

Here are some KDramas that are considered to be the top of their game and have little or no romance:Misaeng (My Incomplete Life) - This is considered to be one of the more accurate glimpses of the working life of a Korean salaryman.Signal - Police Drama with a time element. Very entertaining.Voice - Police Drama with a very wicked serial killerThe Defendant - Legal Drama with another very wicked bad guyThe Romantic Doctor Kim - Medical Drama, some romance, but the story is much bigger and better than the romance portion Now, some more adult love stories that you might enjoy:It's Okay, That's Love - Deals with childhood trauma, love, and mental illness The Good Doctor - Deals with a Doctor that has autistic spectrum issuesFantastic - Deals with Cancer, Love, Friendship, Death and dying

You Who Came From The StarThis drama caught my attention as soon as I heard about it.  It is a hilarious drama with (of course) love, bromance, E.T. references, embarrassment, etc.  This drama also stars two great actors/actresses:  Kim Soo Hyun (Actor) and Jun Ji Hyun (Actress).  In this drama, an alien lands on Earth 400 years before present time in the Joseon Dynasty.  He meets a present day actress, who turns out to be his neighbor, and the story starts from there only going up.  Do watch this, you won't regret it and you will fall in love with both the alien and the alien's actor.

These are my all time favourites. My love from another star- I loved the whole plot, Jeon Ji Hyun's character was really different from the usual female leads. Plus, hot alien! Goblin- This was a masterpiece, not only in terms of story and plot but also the cinematography and music! It's also in the fantasy genre like the previous drama and does it complete justice. Decendents of the Sun- The plot and the romance were so well intertwined that nothing ever seemed forced. Totally recommended! Oh My Venus- This was a simple romantic comedy K-Drama and Shin Min Ah is a delight to watch! It's okay, that's love- This drama is a slightly more thought provoking drama but just as entertaining. The psychological aspect never seemed too intense and gave just the right amount of feels. Watch this for the chemistry between the leads and the beautiful way mental health is showcased.

Apart from what have already been listed here , I would recommend : Strong Woman Do Bong Soon This drama mainly focuses on Do Bong Soon who has immense super human strength , this strength is hereditary and has been passed only to the female members of her family. The story as a whole is covered in sixteen some episodes , what I liked about this drama is the transformation of Do Bong Soon ..she indeed has immense physical strength but throughout the series she also goes to being strong willed as well. Also , the chemistry between lead pairs doesn't seem made up .. though a bit cheesy at times but it adds up quite naturally to the flow :) 2) Faith /The Great Doctor  This drama is about a modern-day plastic surgeon (Kim Hee-sun in picture ) who is kidnapped and travels back in time to the Goreyo period, 700 years in the past . If I were to pick one Lee Min Ho's drama , unarguably it would be this one. Picture credits: From Google

The story is set a hundred years after a war between the Empire of Snow (Ice Tribe) and the Fire Tribe, where the Fire Tribe was defeated. However, the war was fatal, leaving Prince Ka Suo and his younger half-brother Ying Kong Shi the only royal heirs and pure-blood ice illusionists left in the Ice Tribe. Conflict ensues after Ka Suo reluctantly ascends to the throne as his lover, Li Luo, and his brother go missing. Ka Suo also accidentally discovers an evil presence lurking in the Ice Tribe's holy shrine. He and his companions enter the mysterious shrine, and defeat head of the shrine, Lady Yuan Ji, only to find out that she has been plotting a conspiracy against him. Ka Suo also experiences hardships in trying to find his lover and brother, not knowing that his brother has lost all of his memories and has become the Fire Prince under his mother's command. A war between the two tribes commences once again, with the two brothers pitted against each other.
